3.description: The phone system suck, try to speak to a customer service representative. I couldn't get through. I hate the automated phone system. What happened to a real person answering the phone.

1.description: CVS charges a bit more for shampoo and sunscreen than Target but sometimes it's so close that I just have to go there and do some quick shopping.  Big enough parking lot and the staff is always helpful.

2.description: I seriously hate having to come here.  The lines are long and they have people working in the store but won't open more registers, you can't find anything in the aisles, and half the time the sales associates have no idea where things are.They have also messed-up photos both ordered online and brought into the store repeatedly and have weird numbers stored under my name for no reason.  The last time, the husband brought these disposable cameras in that we had used at the hospital where our babies were for many months and he left the order in his name, but when he came back (it took weeks to develop as they said they had to ship them out -wtf?) half of it was under my name, half the prints were over-developed or useless and it cost $50.  So done with this crap.

0.description: I started coming here when this was an Osco. It has since changed hands to a CVS - and I was happy about that. I prefer a CVS to Walgreens any day - I always feel they are cleaner and better stocked with items I would actually buy.There are several downfalls with this location, however. The hours are short - I would really prefer a 24 hour location. Because of the shorter hours, I have HAD to go to Walgreens for prescriptions and what not in an emergency. The people that work here are not terribly friendly. The pharmacy people might be the most unpleasant, but the people working as cashiers are really not much better. I have never had a super friendly experience at this store.I will always keep going here, though. The location is great and, as I said, they always stock what I am looking for. Just wish they were a little nicer!

4.description: I love shopping at this CVS store. Everyone seems so nice and friendly. One of the best experience that i got was in the pharmacy. I went to pick up my dads prescriptions. It was a busy saturday. I didnt wait too long. However, the girl who helped me (her name is Denisa) was really sweet. My dad's insurance wasnt working somehow. Denisa told me that she needed to contact the insurance company. I literally waited for 5 minutes and everything went perfect. She helped me and i felt so comfortable and welcomed by her service.

0.description: I just received my bundles from ALL Exclusive Hair and they are beautiful. I can't wait to go to the salon.

attributes.Hair Types Specialized In: African-American Hair, Asian Hair, Curly Hair, Extensions, Kids' Hair

58.description: My Grandpa used to go here all the time to pick up their delicious rye bread. It was always a staple at their house when it came to lunch. Another favorite from this bakery is pumpkin slices. Mmmmm.

29.description: When it comes to the quintessential birthday cake, you have to get it from Reuter's. All my birthday cakes since I was a baby have been purchased from Reuter's (and I wish there was a way to add photos on here, because I can show you some darling cakes from when I was two and three years old).   My favorite is the yellow cake with buttercream frosting and fresh strawberry filling.  There's no bakery on my side of town that can write such beautiful script in piped frosting.  Perfection (and shows years of expertise).

42.description: The best chocolate cream (real custardy cream) eclairs in the city.  This is like an old world bakery - good coffeecakes, great donuts, appie slices, all the old staples.  Come hungry - or come before you go to visit someone for an overnight - after you treat them to breakfast, you will be assured another invite.

23.description: The "frosting on the cake", was their wedding cake for our son and daughter-in-law's reception in October. It was as delicious as it was beautiful!  Reuter's has been our family bakery for over 40 years... from birthdays to graduations to everything in between. And they're  always happy to customize an order to make it special. Be prepared, though. Once you walk in the door, it's impossible to leave without buying a few extra's.  Delicious!  Sue H.

47.description: This place is old school in a cool way.  They have been in business since the 1920s. I've been here several times for a pastry or to pick up breakfast for the whole office.  Good pastries, coffee cakes, breads, cakes, cookies, and more.  They always seem to be preparing some special holiday pastry.  Last time I was there they were selling zeppole which I never had before and it was delicious.  Parking has never been a problem on Grand Avenue.

8.description: I LOVE this place! We order all of our cakes from here and they have never disappointed. The staff is so helpful and the bakers are amazing. I've ordered everything from regular cupcakes to a full sheet cake with a god awful amount of writing and everything has been great. Their buttercream is to die for and they will give you exactly what you ask for. It's reasonably priced they've come through with just a day notice. I've been coming here for 20 years and will be coming for another 20!

31.description: Ordered a  graduation cake for our daughter. White cake, fresh strawberry cream filling with chocolate whipped cream frosting. It was beyond delicious. Fresh, tender, chocolatey, and incredibly delicate. This cake was worth every penny. Only bad thing was there were no left-overs, everyone had to have seconds. Rueter's has friendly staff and if they're in season amazing velvety pumpkin slices also. ( their fresh whole-peach upside down cake is another out of this world concoction) serve it warm with a scoop of fresh vanilla......Heaven

34.description: Haven't been here personally and writing from out of state, but my mother purchases their Zeppole every year for St. Joseph's Day (they're only available around this time) and they are out of this world!  Unfortunately I haven't been back home in mid-March for a few years so I've been missing out...  but if you have a chance to enjoy their Zeppole you're in for a treat!

16.description: They literally saved my bacon . I was in desperate need of a butterscotch cake and had called around for an hour. They made me a butterscotch cake! and it was delicious

13.description: Wow!  Easy parking.  Great and expansive selection.  Friendly service.  I will return, and soon!  This place is great!

11.description: Needed a special cake for sisters 50th birthday. Went in on Friday May 2nd with my idea, they took it and ran....we could not have been happier with the results! Not only did they exceed my expectations, they were very affordable! Will not hesitate to recommend them to anyone who needs a cake or anything!!

39.description: My parents' wedding cake came from here.My parents' 25th year anniversary party cake came from here.My parents' 50th year anniversary party cake came from here.I have been coming here since before I was born. Seriously. Everyone seems to talk about the cakes. But it's the cookies and the bread that you want. I regularly make the drive from the west burbs to bring up cookiesa nd bread home.The Rye bread and the Hosta is the best in the area. Just amazing. You can't find bread like this anywhere else. And the cookies. The best ever. Get the ones that look like logs with sprinkles on the ends. Actually, get any of them.When I bring them for the family get togethers, fights break out. When I lived at home, I hid the cookies from the siblings to order to have some for myself.

37.description: I love Reuter's Bakery. Their cakes are wonderful and beautiful. The attention to detail is amazing and they are delicious.The reason for the missing star is because their service is not overly friendly. I spend alot of money at their store, I could at least get a thank you. Also, I was sickened by the fact that I saw them accepting 2 LINK cards from the same patron at the same time. That is fraud. Glad to see I am paying $90 for my cake and then my taxes are paying for someone else's. I really love their cakes and will continue to give them my business. It is my hope that they read these comments and take them to heart.

0.description: Hands down BEST eclairs ever! Cannoli's are wonderful too! Everyone who works there is so nice.

38.description: This is the most amazing bakery...if you want a cake thst is to die for order the roman treat! Amazing pastry crunchy napoleon bottom layers of custard , banana and fresh whipped cream and adorning the top all around are these amazing homeade cream puffs.....

51.description: I'm not a huge fan of the cakes, as they keep them in the window unrefrigerated and they also sell those cakes....But lets talk about the donuts! They are quite tasty, especially the Long Johns. So if you are ever in the area, and its early stop in for a donut.

27.description: Great bakery! I've gotten all my kids birthday cakes there. Delicious!

32.description: I recently ordered a cake for my sister's baby shower.  My wife and I were paying for the shower and we originally planned on just going to Sam's Club to save some money on the cake.  My family has been going to Reuter's for as long as I can remember and I decided that I had to at least look on their website.  I fell in love with a cake and we went in to price it out.  In the end the cake came to $83.00.  Even though we felt that was really expensive for a half sheet cake, we decided the cake was just too pretty and adorable to pass up.  The morning of the shower my husband picked the cake up and brought it home just for me to discover that the little baby boots were missing.  I was very upset since I had specifically said I wanted the cake exactly as pictured and expressly stated I was only getting the cake because of the baby booties.  I called them immediately and the manager said that all she was able to do was refund me the $6 charge for the baby boots.  I told her that as far as I was concerned that was not good enough because I only chose this cake because of the baby boots.  She said I would have to wait until Tuesday to speak to the owner and she told me that I needed to take a picture of the cake so that I could prove the cake was not done correctly.  I called on Tuesday and said that I could not come in as I had my small son to take care of and I thought it was unfair that I needed to make another trip there with proof that they did not give me the cake I ordered.  I again told her that it was not about the $6 because I would have never spent $83, if there was a chance that my cake would have been decorated so poorly.  She told me the owner was in a meeting and promised that she would call me back with a resolution before 6:30 p.m.  That was on March 27th and needless to say I am still waiting to hear back.  As far as I'm concerned, they can keep the $6 that they were willing to refund.  We have many more functions coming up including our son's dedication and first birthday party and I will definitely be choosing another bakery for all our special events.

54.description: Love it!! I've ordered from here plenty of times.  And I really love cake. Had it for my son's baptism this past November, and got plenty of compliments from my guests.

48.description: I really love the baked goods here. That being said I was disappointed with my holiday experience. I had placed a large order for Christmas Eve and Christmas Day and for my mother's birthday which is Christmas Eve. I went in the morning of Christmas Eve and they did not have my order. It was very crowded and I had my two young children with me. I waited and waited and waited....I had ordered cupcakes for my mom's birthday and they offered me two cupcakes frosted with brown frosting since it is all they had. Um, no. They pulled coffee cakes and cookies I had ordered. I ended up buying small pastries to use for the birthday since I really couldn't wait any longer for them to make the cupcakes. In their defense, they charged me minimal for my order since they realized they had messed up.On a side note, my 2 year old son tried eating one of their display cakes during the wait out of hunger and frustration. I felt a little bad...but not really.

44.description: Been going to this bakery since i was a kid, Love their custard I still haven't found good edible custard as well as Reuter's...yummy!

24.description: I love this place- wonderful baked goods. I have ordered my cakes from them for a long time. The cakes have been wonder, fresh and creative. You def get what you pay for.My only reserve is the pricing for custom orders. It sometimes seems to rely on the mood of the head baker...especially for custom sugar cookies.

7.description: Great bakery no doubt but it will hurt your pocket a bit. Ordered a cake here once- a small cake for amount 12 people and I paid 75+tax on it. The cake tastes great! But felt it a bit much. Cake was chocolate and yellow doing with strawberries and chocolate moose. Wish that for that price I could've gotten it a bit bigger.

49.description: update - the tornado chasing a race car cake was fantastic.  So delicious that I wished I had grabbed business cards so many people were asking me where I got it - and writing it down.   So cool was the tornado we did variations for the 5th and 6th.  He made it in whipped cream too, as I dont care for buttercream much (although the buttercream here is very nice)I recently was wise enough to choose a Pear Parfit cake from their window recently.  Wow.  white cake with a pear mousse frosting and filling.  I am going back bright and early tomorrow to get one to bring to work.  My new favorite!

40.description: AWFUL service.  Who cares if the cake is good if they won't let you in?I've never been to Reuter's - because the manager for wedding cake appointments wouldn't let me make an appointment!I don't know who I spoke with.  She asked when the wedding was (August 3, 2012) today is November 17, 2011.  The lady said, "I think it's too early.  But you can look at our website and come back after New Year's."I didn't even request a day or time for an appointment yet.  I am unapologetic for getting things done for my wedding early instead of rushing around like a Bridezilla at the last minute, sobbing over a melted buttercream cake.  Also, this bakery is far from home.  So I wanted to plan my appointment for a day I'd be in the city.

53.description: Always fresh... Great service... I've only had one not so great item here... I think it might just not have been suited to my tastes...

30.description: I've eaten almost everything at  Reuter's through the years: cookies, pastries, cakes, sweet rolls, breads, various bars; I've always been drawn(and re-drawn) to their great eclairs and Napoleons. Recently I re-discovered their doughnuts. They have very good doughnuts. I've always loved cake doughnuts, and Reuter's has good ones. But now I'm hooked their Crullers, especially the chocolate crullers. Reuter's makes great Crullers!

46.description: I wanted to have something very special for my Daughter's 21st Birthday.    I brought  in a pic of a White Channel Make-up bag and Mac make-up which included the brushes and a lipstick.  The decorator did and Excellent job.  My daughter and her friends were estatic.  It was everything I asked for and the surprise on my daughters face will always be treasured. The cake was very moist and tasty.  Just like a Birthday cake should be. (perfect)  Hats off to Rueters the best bakery around. And the best decorators bar-none. Take a peek at their site I uploaded the Channel Bag & Mac Make-up.

1.description: I adore and support family long time owned businesses and love this bakery. I used to order from Oak Mill Bakery (last time I tried, that was a BUST-see my previous separate review on that)... My first time ordering from here was for my baby shower cake. I had brought in a similar cake picture of a design I wanted and a copy of my invitation. They were able to make that cake style and decorations in the colors of my invitation (and also the color theme of the shower!) Although pricey, you can't expect class that this place delivers without paying for it. If you want cheap, go get a plain sheet cake from Jewel or Costco. Flavor? RED VELVET. YUM!!!!!! I will DEFINITELY order from here again in the future. YOU HAVE A LIFE LONG CUSTOMER FROM THIS HAPPY GAL RIGHT HERE!

55.description: I went here for the first time yesterday to pick up a cake I ordered for a baby shower. I won't go on and on about every detail and be overly descriptive, but I will say that the cake was perfect, and they had gotten the design I emailed in just right. The flavor, texture, consistency etc. was perfect as well. My family and I, who got to partake in the leftovers said nothing short of "THIS is the kind of cake I like." It was obvious to me that the other reviewer blabbing on and on about donuts is clearly a malicious individual with a personal hatred for this bakery. Yelp should delete those sorts of reviews. P.S. the frosting was delicious AND I am not a neighborhood person, so when I "die off" people like me will still go to this place, believe it or not. The price was also very reasonable. For the amount of cake I got I would have paid about the same at the grocery store but got a fresh, made to order cake instead. And the design was very inexpensive.

9.description: We have been going to Reuter's Bakery for years and there is nothing like it in the city. Parking is convenient. The staff is pleasant and super efficient which is excellent since there are usually a half dozen customers at any time ordering a bunch of items and many long-time customers like us- a good sign for sure! In selecting our family's bakery we were looking for high-quality, super fresh, reasonably-priced coffee cakes, breads and cookies and we found all that at Reuter's. But what really sold us were their Hot Cross Buns. They are sold during Lent but one of the ladies told me they can make them other times of the year given enough notice. Did I mention their excellent customer service? Highly recommended!

26.description: Nice neighborhood bakery.  I like get doughnuts from my office here.  I've had coffee cakes, croissants, and doughnuts from here and they were delicious.

25.description: Sweet rolls are hands down the best I've ever had. Always order them when visiting my mom or when she comes to see me. Yum!

12.description: Reuter's has the best buttercream frosting in the world. My family gets birthday cakes from there religiously. I kind of feel like ordering a cake now...

59.description: I completely disagree with Yvonne's review and Richard's remarks just displays his courage to have someone who challenges his baking skills to come to the shop. They have a good bread selection and okay pastry selection.  If we want to talk over rated and over priced that would by Rosers Bakery. So why do I really love this place? Well me and my wife got our cake from here. And it was beautiful and everyone loved it. My friend loved it so much he and his fiance practically copied our cake for his wedding. The fresh fruit option was great... I get depressed thinking about that cake because it was probably the best cake i ever had. The butter cream frosting wasn't to sweet to or to buttery, just perfect.  Oh yeah and the price for a three tier cake or 4 tier cake was amazing. By far the cheapest we found. FYI For our cake we just brought in a picture and a hand drawn design that we made and they outdid our expectations.

21.description: I LOVE this place! We order all of our cakes from here and they have never disappointed. The staff is so helpful and the bakers are amazing. I've ordered everything from regular cupcakes to a full sheet cake with a god awful amount of writing and everything has been great. Their buttercream is to die for and they will give you exactly what you ask for. It's reasonably priced they've come through with just a day notice. I've been coming here for 20 years and will be coming for another 20!

17.description: When it comes to the quintessential birthday cake, you have to get it from Reuter's. All my birthday cakes since I was a baby have been purchased from Reuter's (and I wish there was a way to add photos on here, because I can show you some darling cakes from when I was two and three years old).   My favorite is the yellow cake with buttercream frosting and fresh strawberry filling.  There's no bakery on my side of town that can write such beautiful script in piped frosting.  Perfection (and shows years of expertise).

10.description: This bakery is the best in the city - a real gem. From custom orders to everyday coffee cakes and sweet rolls, you can taste the quality ingredients, like real butter and whip cream, in every bite. Yummy!

5.description: Reuter's made my wedding cake for my wedding on June 27, 2015. Reuter's was wonderful throughout the process of deciding where and what wedding cake I wanted. I called them and asked them to taste some of their cakes. When I came in for the tasting, the samples were mini cakes of the various flavors that I wanted to try. They let us take them home and sample them. It was really nice that they provided a generous sample so that my parents could sample the cakes too. After sampling cakes from a few different bakeries, I decided on Reuter's for both the quality and the price. I picked a design that they had in a window display for the cake design and went with different flavors for the different layers of the cake. The week of my wedding, the bakery even called me to verify the flavors and the design of the cake. The cake was delivered on time the day of my wedding and was both beautiful and delicious! The cake was so good that we could not wait to eat the top layer so we ate half of it on our two week anniversary and saved the other half for the one year anniversary. I highly recommend Reuter's for anyone looking for their wedding cake!

3.description: My family has been coming to Reuter's for over 30 years.  My Italian mother is extremely picky when it comes to bakeries.  We love our cannoli's, zeppole's , napoleon's (any Italian pastry for that matter) and Reuter's makes the best in my opinion.  Their custard far surpasses any other I've tried and yes there is a difference when it comes to custard.  We only buy zeppoles (for St. Joseph's day) here.  No where else.  Just not the same.  They make excellent cannoli cakes, tiramisu cake, and their Boston crème cake is delicious as well as all of their pastries and breads.  It is always worth the drive, always fresh and there is no place like Reuters!!!  Hope they are around for another 30 years.

35.description: The cake style chocolate donuts are to die for. Everything fresh and delicious! Dunkin can't compare.

19.description: I had been to a 'bakery' in Oak Park, that did not bake their own goods.  They had a super delicious raised donut with fresh strawberries. I don't remember how I determined that it was Reuter's that actually made that donut. However, I decided to go to Reuters. Bakery Heaven!  My husband says that their chocolate donuts are the best ever. I still like those fresh strawberry donuts, as well as their custard donuts.Their fancy cookies are wonderful. They used to serve free coffee....but like lots of things, that is a thing of the past. I have had one of their custom cakes at a baby shower that was excellent, as well as beautiful.     It's not easy to be a stand alone bakery these days with grocery stores like Jewel and Mariano's around. However, those big stores don't bake from scratch. You will see frozen layers of cake that have been shipped in to the stores to be frosted. Half baked breads, or frozen bread dough from large bakeries that are baked by the stores. Yes, it's convenient when you're at the store buying your groceries. However, those products cannot compare to a true bakery - a really good bakery such as Reuters. I'm old enough to remember when most towns had a bakery. These days we have to drive to a stand alone bakery, because there are so few.       Make the effort to go to Reuters. You will be glad you did!  Delicious, fresh, wonderful!

28.description: For years my family has gone to Reuter's for birthday cakes, cupcakes, butter cookies, specialty pastries and more. Great local feel and top quality! The cupcakes are amazing! Always the perfect choice to bring to hosts too. Reuter's absolutely deserves its stellar reputation as a first-rate bakery and Chicago mainstay.

45.description: Ordered a rocket themed birthday cake for my space-loving son's fifth birthday. It completely blew me away! All expectations exceeded. Of course my son loved it too!!!

33.description: This place has everything and anything you need to satisfy your sweet tooth! If you watch all those cool cake shows on TV and you want one like that, they can totally pull it off! They are extremely talented and make some beautiful & delicious cakes! Don't be fooled by the fancy overpriced boutique looking bakeries. They may look nice but they do not taste NEARLY as delicious. It's been around for about 85 years, and family owned for about 40, so you know it's consistent.Aside from the cakes, they make fresh from scratch donuts, sweet rolls, coffeecakes, cookies, breads, you name it! Once you try a donut from here, you will never ever want to step foot inside of Dunkin' Donuts again. It's one of the few places still around that makes QUALITY goods at an affordable price. They are also very helpful when it comes to ordering a cake. You can call in a day before & they manage to whip up a tasty masterpiece by the next morning, it's like magic! And did I mention the CANDY TURTLES!?! they have entire pecans in them! They are the most heavenly thing I have ever encountered!Seriously, if you have a hankering for anything sweet, or just some good quality bread, don't hesitate to stop in and give it a try. I've never been disappointed.

43.description: The cookies are yummy!! Smells so great in here and they offer a good value.super location- parking in back...now the not so good....service is not smiley and joyful and the cupcakes are just ehtasted many days old..will go again though

2.description: We bought my daughter's Frozen cake and it was delicious.. Fresh strawberries and chocolate mousse (on point).... The price was reasonable too..I'll definitely buy in this place again!!

18.description: I love this place- wonderful baked goods. I have ordered my cakes from them for a long time. The cakes have been wonder, fresh and creative. You def get what you pay for.My only reserve is the pricing for custom orders. It sometimes seems to rely on the mood of the head baker...especially for custom sugar cookies.

41.description: I just have to give out a shout that Reuters is the best bakery around.  The bakers do a great job and everything you buy from bread to cookies, sweet rolls, cakes are all great.  I must comment about Nancy.. she is the best..  She is super nice and always willing to please.  I come in every Sunday and  I'm always greeted by Nancy with a smile and how are you.  As we know that is rare these days.  Even when a Customer is not too nice Nancy remains top class.   Rueters is so lucky to have such a great lady working for them.  The other girls are fine as well but in my books know one can compare to Nancy.

52.description: Finding a place to park was a bit of a challenge considering there's no parking lot and the residential area south of Grand prohibits parking unless you have one of those stickers on your windshield.  For some reason, if you go a little east, you'll be able to find regular parking.  However, I had to park about 4 blocks east and 2 blocks south to stay out of the clear.Once I got there, everything looked good and it seemed like the place hadn't changed a bit.  There was one old lady and about 4 high school aged girls behind the counter.  I ended up getting some cannolis, Neapolitans, rectangular slice of chocolate cake with a rasberry on top ($1.97 each), an eclair sandwich with whipped cream inbetween ($2.01), and a marshmallow horn ($1.53).  Overall, everything tasted great, with the eclair sandwich being the standout winner.  Not too crazy about the location.  It would be nice if they were located in a parking friendly area.

50.description: I seriously do not understand where some of these reviews are coming from. SERIOUSLY!Yes the parking is kinda crazy... it's located on Grand and Harlem. But I have never had to park four blocks away. There is usually parking available around the corner. And this place has been there forever.. no one has a parking lot around there unless you are a big box store.But getting back to the bakery itself. This is an old German bakery that has been around since what feels like the beginning of time. And when you walk in it feels and looks like it. You have many ladies working the counter that have been there since I was a wee one.It still has the same tile... everything. This is not your posh bakery... people go back because they know a good thing.. that is basic and is yummy! No gourmet cupcakes or anything like that.My family has been going there forever... every birthday cake, holidays... my sisters and I used the bakery for our wedding cakes.. for which at each wedding we did something different so they wouldn't be the same... and on all reviews the cakes were AWESOME! Bread, doughnuts, pastries, christmas cookies, marianne cakes (yum)... birthday and wedding cakes... all are awesome.Those neigh~sayers with reviews down below must have been having a bad day when they were there...

4.description: Update.... I just spoke with Richard (the cake boss-lol) and he was very professional and offered me a $100 refund. I'm still unsettled over the fact that the lady who took my order seemed to just ignore all my requests. Will not order a birthday cake with them again but I'm pleased with the way that the owner dealt with the situation.

6.description: I do not give my praise unless a place is truly outstanding!!! My fiancé I went in to Reuter's for the first time this morning. We went in with wedding cake appointment and had arrived early. As we were parking we noticed the large number of customers that were in and out of the bakery and took it as a good sign. Once we walked into the bakery we saw that there was a large group of people ordering all types of pastries. Although I wasn't looking to buy any sweets once I saw all of the delicious pastries I had to at least try one and it was as delicious as it seemed. When it came down to our appointment we were taken care of by an employee named Nancy (when I say taken care of I mean it!) Nancy was very helpful and made our experience very delightful. She helped us  make our wedding cake decisions on the style, flavors, colors and size of the cake. Oh and she gave us a platter of different samples to taste which tasted very good. All in all an awesome place!

22.description: Ordered cupcakes for a gender reveal party. They were amazing! Only one cupcake had the gender color filling which made it so much fun to find out. The staff was kind and was one of few bakeries that would actually do this request for me. The theme was bows or bowtie and the cupcakes looked great. I will go back for whatever else I need. Oh and p.s the Bowtie won!

15.description: L'VE, LVE, LVEEverything here is great! Pastries & service!  What more could you ask for?!?

57.description: I've never set foot in this bakery, yet I've managed to sample quite a few of their treats. The cake at my bridal shower was fantastic, full of fresh strawberries and I had a similar berry cake at someone else's party.  A customer at my work had also brought in various treats on a number of occassions now. Everything from cookies to donuts to pastries. All fantastic. There's even fruit pastries with less frill for those who don't care for too much sweet. One day I'll make it into the actual shop. . .

20.description: I had been going to this bakery every now and then for the past 40 years and I have seen the quality decrease, as well as customer service. Since I've experienced bakeries such as Webber's and Orland Park Bakery, I really know what GREAT BAKERY tastes like. Now, quality is just so-so here at Reuters. I went in this past week and the exact same thing happened that happened the previous time I went in there a month ago. Even though I had a number, the short older clerk took a person before me who she knew by name and did not look at whose number was next.  I can understand that happening once, but twice in a row?  I'm staying out of there and going to the grocery chain the block down instead, which has high quality bakery items.  That is, if I can't get to my two favorite bakeries I mentioned above.

36.description: Sweet Mother of god!Order the (not on menu) "Philadelphia Strawberry Cheesecake in the rectangular tin".......Done and done!!! Order 2!!Then thank daddy later....

14.description: Ordered cupcakes for a gender reveal party. They were amazing! Only one cupcake had the gender color filling which made it so much fun to find out. The staff was kind and was one of few bakeries that would actually do this request for me. The theme was bows or bowtie and the cupcakes looked great. I will go back for whatever else I need. Oh and p.s the Bowtie won!

1.description: Horrible, horrible service. I went there and ordered a number 4 combo with turkey sausage and a French vanilla iced coffee. I got my sandwich and I had to wait for another 4 minutes until someone realized they never made my coffee. When I got to my car and started driving I realized my iced coffee wasn't flavored. Then I got home and realized I had no hash browns and that my sandwich was regular sausage. After looking at the receipt I saw that at least they didn't charge me for the hash browns, but I was very very explicit when explaining that I wanted the combo.I usually wouldn't care enough to complain, but they messed up every single part of my order. That's just pathetic in my opinion.

2.description: It's really sad when you have to download a picture of what a 2 scoop sundae is supposed to look like because the sad, pathetic thing they sent my boyfriend home with was BARELY a 1 scoop sundae. When he said something  before he left, they actually told him that the ice cream was just supposed to cover the BOTTOM of the cup. What they ADVERTISE and charge $4.00 for, is 2 scoops that fill the small cup and the toppings that go ON TOP. My "topping" of whipped cream didn't even reach the rim of the cup. It was about a tablespoon of ice cream with some hot fudge and whipped cream. I was actually shocked when I saw it!! So I called to complain and my boyfriend (being the amazing guy he is) went back and got me a "real" sundae. Why couldn't they just do that the firs time??

0.description: If you're looking for a trendy, Starbucks experience then this probably isn't the place for you. On the other hand, if you want a good cheap cup of coffee and some free entertainment then you're in luck. When the ladies that work there get to know you, they'll see you coming and will be getting your coffee ready as soon as you walk in. (They also argue with each other in Albanian, but that's none of my business) Also, there's a lot of regulars there in the morning and the more you go in there, people will start to call you by name. You'll almost swear you're in an episode of that old TV show "Cheers" lol. Fun, fun, fun :)

3.description: I wish that I could give these women 0 stars instead of 1 which is the minimum on here.  Not only were they disgustingly overpriced, but they did awful work and on top of that were rude primadonnas.  We used them for my friend's wedding and not only did they f$%^ up my hair (I had to pay $150 for all 10 mins they spent on me), but they also wanted someone to fetch them coffee and pay for their parking.  I would have gotten into it with them that day, but am pretty sure they are in the mafia.  When the majority of us re-did our hair on our own, they verbally assaulted us, to the point where one bridesmaids hid in the bathroom until they left.  These stylists are straight out of My Cousin Vinny and so are their 80's New Jersey hairstyles.

1.description: Im new to the area so I had no idea where to go to get a simple trim. I tried this place because its close to my work and there was a sign saying 30% first time customers.I told her I wanted a trim. Mind you that my hair went well below my shoulders..longest ive ever had it. By the time I left it was below my chin..so short and no layers like i said! it was 100% opposite of what i wanted! I was mad and said i didnt like it...she said "I think it looks really cute" umm ok but that doesnt give me back my HAIR!! I will not go back to this place. A. because the girl looked like a  hooker with 5 inch heels and a mini dress on and B. because she ruined my hair! dont fall for the 30% off...pay the extra at a different place!

2.description: If I could give this place a 0 stars I would. This place was ridiculous. I used them, unfortunately, for my wedding. WHAT A MISTAKE!!!!!   They were recommended by my make-up artist, who was phenomenal by the way. However they showed up, raised their prices by 1/3 when they saw my suite. Charged me $225 for one of the worst hair do's I have ever had in my life. 6 of my 7 bridesmaids had to have my mom's best friend (who is a hair dresser--thank god) fix their hair. One of my bridesmaid got a total of 5 minutes of service for $85 and her hair looked like trash. They were crappy, did crappy work and I promise that you will see 6 other reviews that say the exact same thing on here in the next few days.

0.description: For the best nails in the world try Angie at Tease Beauty Lounge. I have been to so many nail salons only to have broken nails the next day, pain during a fill or a fungus. After giving up on having great nails I fell upon Angie at Tease. My nails have never looked or felt better. She takes great pride in her work and I recieve compliments all the time! Angie takes the time to do your nails right.She is the best!

4.description: Linda did my hair for the wedding and I will continue to only trust her from now on! She does an awesome job at updo's, cutting, styling, highlighting, you name it. You'll feel right at home in this stylish salon full of outspoken shoot-from-the-hip ladies. Again, a little pricey, but I only style my hair 3 or 4 times a year and I feel like a movie star everytime I leave her salon.

3.description: The drive-thru is SUPER SLOW & takes 10-15 minutes unlike the city.. One time I went there and the drive-thru line was too long, so I just parked and went inside. It seems they're short on workers, or motivation; perhaps both. Everyone was slow-moving, not really courteous to customers.. they were like walking zombies. The food is just like any other BK - it just takes 10x longer than any other drive-thru..then again, they even took a long time when I walked inside. Avoid this place if you're impatient like me and are looking for a quick bite-n-go.

1.description: This place is like paying to get trash. I got a 4 piece nugget and they were rock hard. They need a new staff and new owner that care about customer service. Bottom like is I wouldn't even feed it to my dog .

2.description: I've been here maybe 10 times over the last several years, mostly through the drive-through for breakfast at my kids' insistence. I've never had a problem inside (aside from the fact that I just don't think much of Burger King's food, aside from breakfast). But I honestly don't think I've ever received what I've ordered in the drive-through. The staff seems pretty friendly, and the drive-through has never been crowded when I was there, so it's not a problem with service, specifically. I almost suspect either the speaker/microphone is incomprehensible, or the numbers posted on the register don't match the numbers on the drive-through sign outside (though my receipt usually  lists the correct items). Every several months I give them another chance and they get it wrong again. My order is never complicated, usually just two meals from the value menu, and at least one is wrong (usually sausage instead of bacon, or the wrong kind of bun/croissant/muffin. I'm almost always in a hurry in the morning so I rarely go back and complain, but I wonder how they could botch up so many orders, especially because I'm usually the only car in the drive through.Another peeve is that they offer Icees on the menu, but the several times I've asked for one (again, over the course of a few years), they tell me 'the machine's broken."

5.description: I get a whopper craving every now and then and your the closest thing in my area. The dining area needs to be clean slightly. And the pop is always flat. Other than that the whopper is hot and fries are fresh out of the fryer.

0.description: I stopped here one day to get a quick bite to eat.  Trying to be healthy at  fast food restaurant, I ordered the Chicken Caesar salad.  They gave me ranch dressing to go with it.  Service was super slow.  Enough said.

4.description: Ordered a double stacker value meal: the one with 2 long crispy strips of bacon, 2 beef patties and this special mayo (which reminds me of the Big Mac sauce).  Well, I was VERY disappointed when I saw my DOUBLE stacker pressed firmly down (looked like a Single Stacker), no crispy bacon falling out of the sides. I had to remove the bun in order to see the bacon, but the bacon was raw and each strip was only about 1.5 inches long (very little).  Oh yeah! and that special sauce...I was barely able to taste it due to the fact they put a little drop on only one side!  On top of that, I ordered a Sprite and received a Coke.  These people really don't care.

1.description: I will NEVER deal with this place again. We ordered flowers for my mother's funeral from here. Paid in advance and gave them specific instructions. The day of the funeral the flowers had not been delivered. I called and was assured they would arrive in 10 to 15 minutes. An hour later (AFTER the service) still no flowers. I called. Their response was that they had nothing to say and would give me credit. Goes without saying that I should get credit when nothing was received. I am so disappointed. These were the only flowers we ordered for my mother. If I ever need flowers again, be assured, I will go elsewhere.

0.description: I have been coming here for years and I love their work. I don't know flowers too well but I love that she asks me what kind of arrangement I want or price point!:)

1.description: This was the worst haircut ever!!!Don't waste your time going here.And definitely  don't use Natalie!

0.description: Used a groupon here back in April and I got what I paid for-ish. It was a good experience while in the shop, it wasn't until I took a real look at my haircut at home that I noticed only one sideburn was trimmed. Eeep, I looked like a goof from the time I left the shop upto the time I leveled out my own sideburns at home. Can't recommend this place if they make rookie mistakes like this.

3.description: I have been taking my son here for his haircut for over a year and they are very fast, friendly, and professional. Plus, they give my little boy some candy for his troubles. LOL!

1.description: Yeah, they can cut hair. But even if you have an appn prepare yourself to wait. I'm mean really wait. Average wait time 1 hour.

2.description: Support your local business!  I (finally) just did...Awesome haircut and shave in one of the very few locally owned barbershops still out there...Watching some action flics, good company, and great detail, precision, and care by the owner/proprietor/barber...I would recommend them to whoever is in the area...

5.description: I've been going to Anthony for years (he's the owner) he is very professional and goes out of his way to make sure I don't wait for more than half hour for our appointment. This place is reasonably priced, a clean location, and also a nice lounge area to sit while you wait. I would recommend this place to anyone looking to get a nice fade.

6.description: I love this place! The barbers are very nice with my son. The price are reasonable the place is large an clean they have a lot of barbers with a big range of styles I've seen them cut a lot of hair it's really busy on the weekends. An they have a reward program my son loves to swipe his card every time he comes there really good with kids!

0.description: I've only been to this shop a couple times since my son's barber started working there but I can say everyone (so far) has been welcoming & friendly, the establishment is very clean and the music is not too loud. 5 stars!!!!

4.description: Good barbershop, and decent price. Parking is a little hard to find so you have to pay for parking. Other then that, it is a great place to get a cut.

3.description: Didn't get to try our pizza. :-(After having it at a birthday party, my friend was excited to try Jet's so we ordered online. (Extra star for the good website & crust options.) But after a while we received a call stating it was outside of the delivery area. (They don't deliver past Ridgeland & we were 2 blocks over.)Pretty disappointed & with hungry toddlers to feed, I called back to see if we could pay $5 extra dollars in delivery fees for the 2 blocks & was rebuffed. We ended up ordering Papa John's & having someone pick it up to avoid another delivery wait.

1.description: The place is pretty new to the neighborhood still. We popped in to try it out yesterday. We ordered an extra large deep dish.. I will say that ordering off the web was confusing, and I didn't know what to expect when the pizza came out. LolThe pizza itself was very greasy- but pretty good. We had a ton left over as well. The staff was utterly confused- it looked like the three people there had no idea what was going on. They tried to charge us again after we already paid. There maybe some training issues there but it is what it is. Yes it is a little pricy for what it is- but you will get full. Very full. We might be back, but I'm definitely more of a pizza hut or rosati's fan.

2.description: Back this weekend just to grab a few slices.  I added some of the cheese bread to two slices and the total was $13!  WTF?  I really don't see this as "premium" stuff either.  The best part is that they advertise "slices available all day" yet you still have to wait 10-15 minutes for your order - the same wait as if you ordered a pizza.  So, you are basically advertising "we will sell our items while we are open."   Super.  The guy behind the counter (not the manager) is also clueless as he couldn't explain the difference between thin crust and New York style to another customer.  Even I can do that and I haven't been through whatever "training" this place offers.  I am done with this place.

5.description: Friend turned me into Jets in Darien. Fresh ingredients and fresh dough complete me. Try the barbecue chicken or Hawaiian. Got the coupon for jet bread and was pleasantly surprised. Will be back again.

0.description: I am a pizza junkie from NYC. I have pizza at least once a week if not more often.  For me it is NOT a throwaway meal. I try pizza everywhere and I don't pull punches when it comes to bad zaa.. When I saw a Coupon for Jet and saw a photo it reminded me of a top Detroit area pizza.  A top 10. Since Jets is a Michigan pizza I gave it a try. I called placed my order and it was ready when I picked it up. . I ordered 2- 4 square pepperoni.  With 4 square you get 4 crispy corners which is key for this type pizza.  The pizza was above average and reasonably priced.  I would definitely order it again.  It is better than most of the other heavily advertised products. This is definitely a pickup or delivery deal. Definitely worth a try. I'm looking forward to my next order.

4.description: Newly opened chain . Tried it with a free slice promo, and really enjoyed it. Fast delivery!

3.description: good coffee.  busy busy location.  the staff are great with the crowds.  the interior is updated and a surprisingly large amount of people eat in.

1.description: Most everyone that works here is friendly. Fast and courteous service with a smile. How refreshing.

2.description: I order coffee and instead I get dark water with cream and sugar. I have been here three times and I will never go back! Don't water down your coffee to save money. You have just lost a customer for the ridiculous business practice of making coffee like water. I'm taking my $1.97 to another DD that makes real coffee.

0.description: They are unprofessional, and the coffee is obviously not standardized. On multiple occasions, all coffee I've received, with the same order has had completely different tastes; some bad and some good. You have to actually familiarize yourself with the personnel in order to get the coffee that you want. Taking back things is an extremely big hassle if the coffee you've received was poor in taste, and I've only did this once. The service is very friendly, but at the same time so rigid and unyielding at times, so much so, that it is not worth going here if you are in a car, where you can go elsewhere for better coffee and better service.

3.description: This bar is God awful. If you love bigotry and racist jokes, and no staff to intervene, this is joint for you. Food is terrible, drink specials aren't good. Kegs aren't fresh. I would give them -5 stars if I could. Nobody is ever here, except for the occasional misogynist pig.

1.description: Kobe burger is very good, and a thick burger! First time I ever saw third shift brewing Amber lager and it's good, even though it's owned by Miller Coors! Owner told me it started off as a craft brewery, until they sold it for $40 million! The bar sells for $3 a pint.  Play your own music, fun owner that's been doing it for 27 years! Very diverse crowd, so I don't what people are talking about racism on their reviews! I'll be back when I'm in the area!

2.description: This place has a bad rap. And I understand why. But they got a good jukebox and a pingpong table. Its not the worst place I've ever been.

5.description: Go for the cheap beer stay for the subtle racism.

6.description: I went into Phils Sports Bar on Thursday night to have a cocktail or two. Kathleen was bartending and provided excellent service. The bar was clean and had bar seating along with tables and stools. The lighting was medium with many beer signs on the wall. At the bar they put out free pop-corn which is an excellent customer service move. Behind the bar they had a Holiday food collection box for the needy, another outstanding move. The establishment has four TVs, a ping-pong table, a bowling machine, a dart machine, a pool table, an ATM and a TouchTunes digital juke box. Kathleen is an oustanding bartender with many years experience in the bar business. She provides great service along with good conversation. Many working class and locals drink at this establisment. Drinks are very reasonable too. For a place to drink and mix it up I say give it a try, especially when Kathleen is bartending (:Down the hatch!!!!!

7.description: This bar is a dive and I love it. Nothing really special here and the bar next door is better looking as my next post wil explain. This one has cheap beer,pool table, and big windows to look at traffic on harlem Avenue.

8.description: Good neighborhood bar. If your looking for a spot to have a few with some friends and watch a game this is the place.

9.description: they have a ping pong table. but if you're drinking you'll be sweating like you ran a marathon!

0.description: Went here last weekend for the NCAA tournament with a few buddies. First off, if you don't enjoy the "dive bar" atmosphere this is not a place for you. That said, if you love dives you have to come check out Phil's! Not only does this place have great, cold beer, it's cheap too - awesome drink and food specials! Also the staff is really friendly and they have an awesome selection of music on the jukebox. We were able to meet the owner Phil and he was a really great guy. In fact one of our buddies drove us all over there and had been drinking, and Phil was extremely cool about leaving the car there over night. Will definitely be popping in this great local joint again soon!Pros: Great specials, friendly staff, good musicCons: Needs more/larger televisions

4.description: Italian Beef Crawl Stop #4:Starting to get slowed down by the volume of beefs and beers, this short trip to the next bar was more than welcome. As we entered there were about two guys in there having an afternoon beer. My friend rolls up and orders a long line of glasses and pitcher after pitcher after pitcher. I commented to him, "This looks like a scene out of a Western flick where the banditos rob the money train and then go in all out buying whiskey!"Some folks picked up the ping pong paddles and started to play a game, still a few more popped in some quarters for Silver Strike Bowling and some others played some pool. I contented myself walking around and chugging out of the small glasses. The outdoors area was sweet with tables and lots of room out in the sun. We did run into some west siders who all had an opinion of where to get good beefs, but Johnnie's would be the next leg of the beef crawl.We probably ended staying here the longest and spent the most money than any other of the bars. We eventually ended up staying at Phil's and then eating Johnnie's at Phil's. The tables were big enough, so there was room for everyone to eat and keep drinking. All in all a decent bar with lots of sports banners, neon lights and cheap beer. A bit far out of my way and nothing compelling to bring me back, but definitely a spot worth checking out if you're in the neighborhood.

1.description: I'm surprised that this business isn't on Yelp yet.. then again, maybe that's because most of its patrons are not American. I enjoy the food here and the atmosphere is trendy and modern. The service is good, and there is an outdoor seating area in front. The food portions are HUGE and I think that the prices are affordable. One thing -- their menu is pretty large, however, the don't always have everything that is on the menu so it's best to just order from the specials list. They have a standard selection of beer at the bar, including a lot of great Czech beers on tap such as Czechvar, Krusovice, Staropramen, Golden Pheasant, and of course Pilsner Urquell as well as others.

2.description: We've travel to Chicago with friends. We were looking for a lace that will have authentic czech food and several beers on tap. We have found it at bistro grand. Very authentic and tasty food, specially apricot dumplings. Will be back! It's must stop place.

0.description: bistro is the best !!! Super obsluha super jidlo super drinky super akce super vsecko :-D :-D

58.description: Ugh.. where to even start!?My wife and I were here just a few nights ago.  We're pregnant with our second and she was seriously craving some Mexican food.  So we went and I have to tell you.. that the food was absolutely horrible.We started off with ordering a virgin pina colada for the misses and it had a strange aftertaste with each sip.  Almost like a metallic type flavor, never found out what it was.Then the standard chips & salsa.. the salsa was utter blasphemy for anything even remotely labeled as "salsa".  It was literally canned tomato sauce (think Hunt's) with some oregano spice dashed into it, served cold.Wow.  Disgusting.The plates were on the same level.  Just writing this review out is making my stomach go queasy. I have found memories of my childhood of this location once being a Pizza Hut.  Too bad it is now just a place for ignorant "Mexican" food lovers to get drunk on bad drinks.

56.description: My friends and I were here almost every Friday night about 10 years ago.  The food was ok, the booze was never watered down but all that has changed.   We have been there several times in the past few months only to be disappointed again and again.   We felt we'd give them a chance since we liked it so much some 10 years back, but it seems every time we dined there, something went wrong like an order was incorrect, poor wait staff, and worst of all, very poor  food quality.   Twice I ordered steak tacos.  You simply  can't mess up steak tacos, right?  Wrong.  It was like eating charcoal on a tortilla.    Some of my friends ordered the steak burrito.   It was like a charcoal filled tortilla that had no flavor other than burnt steak.   Disgusting.   The chicken was flavorless, the fajitas were extremely greasy and God forbid if you ask the wait staff for anything.   I swear the guy rolled his eyes when we politely asked for another glass of water.   As if  we were bothering him.  I guess he was too busy trying to score with the table full of drunk girls that sat across from us.   I don't understand how this place can be as packed as it is.   I guess some people just don't know good food.  Oh well Maria's, I really tried to like you again but it was just too many strikes.  Maybe the staff can lighten up and the cooks can learn how to season the food and NOT BURN THE STEAK EVERY TIME.

29.description: Mediocre at best. Notice all the reviews saying the margaritas are great? You'd have to be drunk to think the food here is as good as they say it is. Not bad for a local mexican grease trap, but it gets the job done. Personally I'd rather hit up a smaller local taco joint.

42.description: They have the best Chimichanga Suizas!!!! The best service, fresh chips and salsa is great. Dont forget the fried ice cream!!!!

23.description: Plan on visiting on next trip to town

47.description: I've been going here for years and it has a great vibe to it. It could be a bit pricey...but ultimately you get what you pay for! I typically love getting the Bistek dinner as it's just huge. When you a dinner, most have the soup or salad options. I chose the soup, which was black bean at the time, and it was great. Though I could have thought they had chowder and chicken noodle...guess it varies by day.  I took my girlfriend here and she loved the vibe and the tequila china cabinet they have near the entrance. The artwork in this place is great and feels very traditional, at the same time it's great that the staff here speaks very clear in both languages! She loved the michelada while I just got a Dos Equis. If I had to complain about anything, I would say that I wish they had imported draft beers. The deserts are all great and filled with liquor too (you can ask to get a virgin desert if you don't want liquor!). So far with multiple times I've been here, I've noticed that the brandy works really well with the flan and the Mexican coffee with the kaluha and brandy with whip cream and sprinkles is great. If you're looking to impress a date and are on a moderate budget, this is the place to go! Not to mention certain days they have a live mariachi band.Pros:Lively environmentGreat music and live entertainmentGreat food and desertAmazing art work on walls and ceilingsCons:Lack of draft beersStaff can sometimes be unattentive and not priortize

8.description: I went here Friday with friends and family for a birthday party. The atmosphere was great and so was the food. I had the chicken and steak fajitas. The strawberry margaritas were awesome. I will definitely be back

31.description: I have never dined in, but for carry out it's good.  my parents like their food, so sometimes I'll pick some up if I go visit.  I really like the chimichangas!

34.description: Maybe my tastes are changing (again) or something.  Maybe it was a much needed margarita.  But it seemed much more enjoyable this time.  I had spinach enchiladas and they were quite tasty.  Nachos were good, too.

16.description: The ambience of this place was really cute! Music played with a great buffet selection. Enjoyed it all although some items off the menu were very average and lacked authenticity.

13.description: Went here to a birthday party and was pleasantly surprised at how good my dinner was. The sangria was delicious too. I definitely am going back.

11.description: Used to be one of my favorite places to eat until last night! Brought my kids there to eat as a family, No kids menu, charged us full price dinner for a pc of chicken $16.75!! for my son. Overall service was mediocre as well as the food! Very Disappointed!

39.description: I just returned from dining at Maria's restaurant with my parents. It was my dad's 62nd birthday. I wanted to take them to a restaurant in downtown Oak Park, but my dad wanted Mexican. He and my mom have been there a handful of times in the past. The experience we had spoiled our evening. When we first arrived, the table next to us, a party of four, had a birthday at the table. The employees came over and sang "Happy Birthday" and put a sombrero on the birthday lady's head. I told my dad we should tell them it was his birthday, but he is a modest guy. As we were eating, a woman at another table received the same birthday cheers. This time, I noticed that she was given a shot. My dad then got out his ID to show the waiter, CARLOS, that is was also his birthday. When Carlos came over, my dad told him that it was also his birthday. He was then basically dismissed. I saw the joy drain from my dad's face. My dad is the most amazing person. He does not relish attention, but tonight, he needed to also feel special. My mom and I sat in belief. Surely, at some point, the staff would come over with birthday greetings. They didn't. I am disgusted. My dad is a police officer, a simple person. We weren't trying to get anything for free. I would have gladly paid for a shot or a piece of dessert. I worked retail through college, and I get that customers can be difficult. We were not those people. When my dad was waiting to tell Carlos it was his birthday, he said to me, "Take my picture when they put the sombrero on my head." I got out my phone only to never have that happen. We didn't go to Maria's with the intent of being sung to, but when it is your birthday and two other parties receive such a celebratory greeting, what makes you less deserving of that same greeting? I will never return to Maria's, and I will discourage others from frequenting Maria's. But the damage is done. My dad left deflated. I did not leave a tip, and I feel a bit guilty about that. I hope in the future ALL people who enter their doors will be treated well.

37.description: I've been coming to Marias for a long time.  My family loves it, however, I think the food is just okay.  They do have great margaritas but a bit expensive for my taste.

0.description: Maria is a cool spot with decent Mexican food. I have been there a few times in the last month or two and both times have been good. It seems like they always have different menu items on special since they gave me a handwritten note with the specials. To me it seemed like most of the people that go there are locals that keep coming back. Service has always been on point and have never had any problems with the meals I have ordered. I have tried their enchiladas and recently the "Pollo Azteca" which were both good. Their margaritas are also very fresh and you can easily swap the tequila for something better if you wish. Usually after 2 margaritas I am already feeling them so thats a good sign for me :D They also have tequila flights however I have not ventured to that just yet. If im in the area I will not hesitate to stop by again.

38.description: the food here is just flat out bad. I have dined here 4 times and was supremely underwhelmed every time. The service was decent, the servers were friendly and attentive. But the food....meh to bad

51.description: Having recently moved to the area, hunting down a good Mexican restaurant has been on my to-do list.  This place is definitely in 1st place so far.   The service is superb in this very nice, candle-lit venue.  The price is pretty much in line with most Mexican restaurants in the Midwest, but you get much more for your money here!  A salad/soup being included in the price for the enchilada meal was a nice surprise.  The salsa was quite spicy, but I'm not  complaining.  If you're looking for a nice dinner, go here.Overall, it was a great experience and I will be returning.

27.description: I would have loved to have tried the food, however after being told to hold on a minute before even taking my order and waiting for nineteen minutes at the take out window, I gave up.Please keep in mind that there were people at two of the tables in the whole resturaunt and guys standing around in the kitchen just looking at me. Horrible service, please avoid if you are looking to eat in under two hours.

32.description: I visited here for the first time about a week ago.  Mediocre at best.  Service was also very slow even though it was not busy.

54.description: Don't listen to these negative reviews.  Maria's has the best Mexican food around the Elmwood Park area.If you like Carne Asada, this is the place.  You get a huge piece of steak, cooked to order, with generous helpings of rice, beans, and guacamole.  Their home made chips are fresh and taste great.  The margaritas are also out of sight!Sometimes the service is slow, but that's when they are slammed or have huge parties.  This place does a real good business, I can't believe all the negative reviews.  IF YOU DON'T LIKE MARIA'S, YOU DON'T LIKE MEXICAN FOOD.

48.description: I had a craving for Gringo Mexican -- you know, a large tortilla filled with ground beef, smothered with melted cheese and red sauce, and swimming in a plate of refried beans and guacamole.But I was TBK-ed out, and there's not a plethora of that kind of food in my neighborhood. I ended up at Maria's and ordered that night's special: Grilled Mahi, shrimp and pineapple rings atop a bed of mango salsa and rice. It wasn't what I was craving -- it was better. Better for me and better tasting. I'm excited to try more of what Maria's has to offer.

44.description: I've been driving past this place everyday FOR YEARS and just walked in today for the first time.LOVED IT!!! People have been telling me to check it out.I had the Carne Azteca which is a char broiled rib eye steak that has a really good chipotle sauce over it.Really enjoyed it.My waiter was very attentive the whole time.They also have a few unique dessert options that I dont remember EVER seeing at any Mexican restaurant.I went with the Maria's Delight.Its bananas sauteed in Brandy over vanilla ice cream.I TOTALLY RECOMMEND THIS PLACE!!! Nice interior as well.

24.description: Group of four came here on a Sunday night for dinner.  We were seated right away.  The server was fairly attentive.  The only issue I really had was the food. It wasn't bad in any way but I felt it just didn't stand out to me in any way.I ordered the enchiladas en mole and an iced tea. It came with a side salad, which was some lettuce with shredded carrots and dressing.  The enchilada plate had some standard beans and rice on the side.  The mole sauce was interesting, as it had some deep chili flavors.  The only problem is that I feel you can get something similar at other mexican places without having to sit down.  Of course if you're looking for a place to take your time and have a relaxed dinner with mexican food, this is your place.

7.description: Friday, about 5:00 pm. went there with a friend after work for some appetizers and margaritas. margaritas were fine. the guacamole was fine. the queso was fine. the fish tacos? first, where was the fish? chopped up with a bunch of peppers....couldn't really taste the fish...eaten taco style all it tasted of was peppers and salt. when i took them apart and picked around for the fish tidbits, they were not very good.kind of disappointing, considering the price.

49.description: I love Maria's. The service is A+, a must for me. The margaritas are fabulous! The carne asada, flautas, and burritos are tasty. This is a perfect neighborhood Mexican restaurant and well worth the many visits I make here. BTW I am Mexican (I know Mexican food)! Not related, not an acquaintance, and not a stock holder. PERFECT for private parties, I had my daughter's communion party there. They opened early and were fully staffed just for our party.

40.description: -ceviche appetizer very good-Excellent fish and seafood platters-Chicken fajitas very good-Margaritas can be wicked

53.description: Mole' Mole' Mole'..... very yummy.I went here with a larger group (8) and were graciously accomodated. The golden margaritas were quite fabulous and set the mood for a fantastic evening.Great atmosphere, decor and attentive waitstaff. (sorry to the patrons around us, we were a bit loud that night)The chicken enchiladas mole were exceptional and generous. The carne asada was fantastic as well.Although not in my neighborhood, I would travel from the NW Burbs back to enjoy more delicious food.

30.description: Very simple. Great food, great margaritas and great prices. You can't go wrong with steak or pork tacos! I have never left un-satisfied, the portions are generous and each meal includes a starter soup/salad!

46.description: The stars are solely based on the food. Very good Chile relleno. The service is horrible.  It seems as if no one wants to work the servers are very ignorant and have bad attitudes.

1.description: Maria's is good. It's not a favorite but definitely place I would eat at again without issue. I have visited twice within the last two months. I ate once at the bar with a friend and the other meal was enjoyed in the dining area. The bar area seems to attract several regulars and is a more lively space. The bartender was busy whipping up drinks the entire time but he took good care of us. We planned to have drinks and move to the dining area but decided to eat there instead. The dining area is nice too. The average meal with a drink is in the $20 range. It is higher priced Mexican but prices are not outrageous.

55.description: I am sure there are better Mexican restaurants than Maria's in and around Chicago but if you are in the area, for the money you can't go wrong.  The waitstaff are consistently helpful and courteous.  The food is fine--the crabmeat quesadillas are excellent and seriously a meal in themselves.  I have never had a bad meal at Maria's--the food is tasty and fairly priced; the portions are very generous and unless you are a really big eater, you'll probably take home enough for a second meal.  Try the Margaritas--they're great!

9.description: This is my second time visiting Maria's if i wrote this review after my first visit a few months ago it would be alot higher rating but this time i was not pleased the food was decent other then the weird tasting salsa for the chips but what was really discouraging was they nickle and  dime everything meaning everything is a extra charge if you want hot sauce for your taco's ETC and the waiter charged me twice on my credit card because he made a mistake all i can say is the food is decent but i wont be back.

26.description: Tasty, quality, affordable, authentic Mexican with a live guitar playing singer to serenade you on some nights.A few cosmetic updates need to be done, but it's still a 5 star based on the quality of food (which is the #1 reason you're going out, right..)

25.description: Neighborhood Restaurant with downtown taste!   The staff are the friendliest around...the food is amazing and very reasonably priced!  Try the Friday "Specials" they are fabulous!!

12.description: We actually came here in August so I apologize for the late review. It was my daughters 18th birthday and we had a party of 12. The restaurant was very accommodating even with it being a busy Saturday night. The staff was helpful and friendly. Our waiter Julian was awesome! My husband really wanted a mojito and was VERY disappointed that they didn't have mint so they couldn't make it. Julian and the owner were very apologetic and comped us a few drinks. The guacamole was fresh and right on. The tortilla soup had just enough spice and definitely hit the spot. I ordered the steak fajitas. They were tender and flavorful. Very good!!!! Plenty of steak to veggie ratio. My sisters chicken soft tacos weren't amazing but she said they were "good". I did find her plate to have too much lettuce for my taste. The staff was attentive and constantly filling waters, taking away finished plates and glasses. All of our guests had a great experience. I can't wait to go back.

59.description: Maria's has been and continues to be a local favorite. Simple, tasty Mexican food with good service. The salsa is exceptional with just enough heat. I'm also a big fan of the enchiladas.

21.description: Back again after a long hiatus and they have changed the menu again!  This time I went with the lack bean soup - which I always forget has raw onion in it and I end up picking that out!  I also got the camarones al mojo de ajo and forgot that these come in the shell and you have to pull them out.. also annoying.  It's also weird that this dish doesn't come with tortillas or beans.  Husband got two chicken tacos and one pork taco - thought it was good, but too much cilantro on the pork.  Our waiter was very good and we had no service issues at all.  I hear they have a Sunday brunch -we should try that and see what else is worth tasting...next time I will stick with the fajitas.

17.description: Been coming here for years and i can definitely say I've never had a bad experience. The food is consistant everytime bringing quality mexican food with a good family type atmosphere. Also be sure and have a margarita too. Can never go wrong with one of those. All in all you will find good authentic mexican food for a decent price, and the portions will leave you taking some home and eating the next day.

10.description: Group of four came here on a Sunday night for dinner.  We were seated right away.  The server was fairly attentive.  The only issue I really had was the food. It wasn't bad in any way but I felt it just didn't stand out to me in any way.I ordered the enchiladas en mole and an iced tea. It came with a side salad, which was some lettuce with shredded carrots and dressing.  The enchilada plate had some standard beans and rice on the side.  The mole sauce was interesting, as it had some deep chili flavors.  The only problem is that I feel you can get something similar at other mexican places without having to sit down.  Of course if you're looking for a place to take your time and have a relaxed dinner with mexican food, this is your place.

5.description: Best strawberry margaritas!! Came here with my coworkers and boss. Our boss treated us to pitchers of strawberry margaritas and were so good! I also ordered their flan, small portion but satisfying to a sweet tooth :)

3.description: First time visiting this restaurant.  Tried the brunch buffee today. The server was very friendly, funny and attentive.  We had a large party and they treated us like family visiting and took special care to accommodate the two newborns in our party and the little ones too.  The selections were delicious.  Some of the options included pancakes, various fruit, steak fajitas, pozole, rice, beans, chicken fajitas, steak and potatoes guisado, tamales, and more.  Our party seemed very happy with the options and went back for seconds.  We will definitely be returning soon!!  PS The owner was present and was very friendly and warm.  Thank you for a wonderful brunch and for accommodating our large party!!

35.description: This place is awesome! I hadn't been here for years after moving from the area and now that I'm back, I went for dinner to satisfy a craving for Mexican. The food was just as good as I remembered. Large portions, great margaritas, reasonable prices, friendly staff. What more could you ask for?

19.description: The waiter was slow and was cocky. Salsa is ok but not great. I got bumped into twice by staff and no apologies given.

28.description: We gathered at Maria's as a large group for a professional business gathering.  While it was my first experience here, some of the others in our party of 15+ were to Maria's before.  Right off the top, the service is poor.  Our cocktail orders were taken by two people, neither knew that the other person was taking our orders.  Slow!!!!  Glasses stood empty for a long time before somebody bothered to return to see if we would like another cocktail.  Very Poor service.Our food orders were finally taken.  The guacamole we shared, was bland and down right blaah.... Totally tasteless!   ....And I was not the only person that confirmed this similar sentiment.  I have never had blah anything served at any Mexican restaurant I patronized in the past.  They F*cked up the guacamole!   For shame!!.... and to call yourself a Mexican restaurant!   Tragic!Our main entrees finally arrived, while they looked quite appetizing, the poor service greatly deflated my expectations of Maria's abilities to deliver something to clap about.  My entree was good, but again, nothing to write home about.In the end.... our cocktail glasses stood empty for too long, cluttering the table.  Nobody bothered to ask if we wanted dessert or coffee.  Horrific service!As a private group, we wanted individual checks or totals and we were given one big bill which was not very accommodating for us.  It's not what we wanted.  The waiter appeared highly disturbed that we wanted to pay individually, like we weren't going to pay.... Our group consisted of professional people 50 yrs old and up...... We came with money! ;)While the south of the border decor was wonderfully and colorfully done, you can not eat decor and must suffer through mediocre service.  I would not recommend this place to anyone I liked a lot.  My advice..... Get your act together or remain insignificant...... This is not the best Mexican restaurant around........ sorry.

45.description: Good food for a decent price. Love their chips and salsa. They have pretty big portions too. You can never go wrong with their enchiladas. The margaritas are awsome too. There is the right amount of alcohol in it.  Also really affordable compared to other places. Plus their waiters are nice and friendly.

33.description: It breaks my heart to write this. My beloved Maria's! I have been eating there since your small original location. I have been eating at Maria's twenty plus years!! The Chicago location just isn't the same. Upon ordering out, this is the THIRD time when we arrived that their credit card system was down. So not being told this over the phone we came without cash not thinking this would continue happening... and than had to run to the atm to come back and get our food. Well, the food gets a little soggy (tortillias with with meat and lettuce with tomato sitting?) Than we say this has happened before and were told that the manager isn't there. I'm not looking for free food (twenty years eating there plus) but geez how about a free something for our troubles. Upon getting home the bean portions were so small and the rice was flavorless missing the the trademark peas and carrots. My meat was dry and had very little lettuce and no cheese.
