Very disappointed.  There are so many restaurant choices and I have raved about Maria's before but sadly the Chicago location has lost its charm. Why Maria why??

43.description: I've come here on several special occasions and it always seems to hit the spot it's a consistent place with both food and service. I was here on Sunday with my entire family all 18 of us and we did not have a reservation but they were more than willing to accomodate and find a big enough spot we almost had a little section all to ourselves. There was so many of us I can't tell you what all of us ate but I can tell you that I had a bomb ass plate!! It was called Ay-Chihuaha pretty much a medium well carne asada with grilled onions mushrooms and melted chihuaha cheese on top with a side of beans and rice and it was deelish!! The price is pretty reasonable the bill was no where near what I thought it would be! so that's even great!!a great place for family, friends, and maybe even some social drinking... Def will be back soon!

2.description: This has very good food. The customer service is excellent and food was delicious. Id recommends this to everybody

18.description: Tasty, quality, affordable, authentic Mexican with a live guitar playing singer to serenade you on some nights.A few cosmetic updates need to be done, but it's still a 5 star based on the quality of food (which is the #1 reason you're going out, right..)

41.description: Maria's is just OK. Nothing to special about it. None of the food on the menu blows me away. However, the chips and salsa are the reason I keep coming back. I do appreciate that they use chihuahua cheese, that is a definite plus.The waitstaff is always very friendly and nice.

52.description: Unfortunately I can't vouche much for the food, but this is more for drinks and service.I came here on a Saturday evening (maybe 6:00 - 8:00) for a few margaritas and conversation with a friend. Though it wasn't very busy, the service was sub-par. We informed the waitress from the beginning that we wouldn't be ordering any food and instead were going to indulge in some margaritas and other drinks. She proceeded to ask us what had to be another 6 times if we were ready to order food. I'm not sure why she insisted that we order food. If she thought she wasn't going to make a good tip because of a low bill then she was wrong, because we were robbed on the drinks.When ordering the drinks, there were no prices listed, and when we asked, she couldn't give a clear answer as to how much the drinks were costing. We were having a good time in conversation and kept ordering anyways. I had maybe 5, if not then 4 drinks, while my friend had 4, and the bill was over $100. We didn't order any food, no shots, it was only a few margaritas and one regular drink. I would have pushed the issue and asked why it was so high but after we were given the bill the waitress wasn't seen for another 20 minutes so I paid and left.They had a man going around asking if we wanted him to play a song for us on the guitar and sing. We politely declined but listened when others welcomed his service and I thought that was kind of cool to have.As for the drinks, they tasted fine. Fair. Nothing amazing but it led us to have some good conversation... But I think we'd all agree good conversation shouldn't cost $100+ for 4 drinks. Blah.

50.description: I think this is a pretty good Mexican place. I have always been content with the food and the margaritas, and the salsa is actually awesome. I guess I only dock it 1 star because while the food is good, I have never had something that really stuck out to me as amazing. But it is still a great restaurant nonetheless. Definitely worth a shot. I have never had a problem with their service - I think it is great.

4.description: *specific location being reviewed: Harlem Ave. Chicago, IL*Great food /customer service here!  Friendly /polite wait staff as well.  Love the Black Bean soup here!  The cheese Quesadillas =yum(:  The gentleman,who walks around playing guitar, provides fun entertainment for everyone at the table

6.description: I'm a super fan!  We are new to this neighborhood but I predict many, many margaritas and mariachis/boleros in our future. The food was good but since we ordered drinks and appetizers, once we were done I felt that we were being rushed to leave.  It was a Friday night and people were lining up at the door so I get it.  We have two young kids so we never stay too long anyway.  I love the darkness of the interior and the drinks were def strong.  They make excellent shrimp ceviche!

22.description: The carne asada was cooked to perfection. Chips were crispy and the salsa was just right. Good food, great service and good drinks!

15.description: Decided to come here for Sunday dinner with the husband mainly due to the fact that this place is about 5 minutes from our home.  Stopped here for an early Sunday dinner, the place is not too busy and upon arrival we were seated right away.  Our server greeted us and took our drink order.  Both my husband and I ordered margaritas.  He ordered the mango froZen and I ordered the peach frozen margarita.  Both were delicious, for dinner we both had enchiladas. He had the enchiladas de mole And I had the enchiladas verdes both with chicken.  Mine were pretty good, nice sized platter.  Verde sauce was tasty but not spicy, overall really good.  My husband did state that his could have used a lite bit more of the mole on them.  Overall he thought the mole was good and was pretty pleased with his choice. Once we were done with dinner and our table was cleared by the server we were expecting him to offer us a dessert menu but instead we had to ask him for it which was no biggie because by this time the place was starting to get packed. Looking over the desserts we decided to go with the fried ice cream.  It was sooooo disappointing which is a shame because we were looking forward to it.   It came out quick and when we went to dig into it with our spoons we were greeted with a frozen ball of ice cream.  I thought the outside was supposed to be warm but nope it was frozen and started getting soggy after each spoon full.  Seems like this fried ice cream was fried the day before and kept frozen In a fridge.  When you ask for it, it then is plated very nicely. Presentation was pretty but this fried ice cream was definitely not made to order.  What a shame because everything else was good.  I will come back but will skip dessert next time.

57.description: Is it possible to get high on cheese?  I think I am high on cheese right now from Maria's Queso Fundido. And her quesadillas.  Ole!

20.description: I was out with my cousin and we decided to try this place an I must say I was quite impressed... The inside is very nice clean and romantic... Our server Carlos was outstanding he made sure we were okay through out the entire time we were there he joked and made us feel extremely comfortable! We had their strawberry margaritas which were great. The food was okay i had the combination so I was able to try out they steak and chicken n I must say their chicken was better tasting than the steak... I will definitely be back even if it's just to sit at the bar and have some margaritas!!

36.description: This place is very clean and neat. The decor and atmosphere are just right. The service is great and the servers are very professional. The food so far has been great as well. I can't say one bad thing about the place.

14.description: My friend and I ordered an appetizer platter and for the first time that I can remember, a Mexican restaurant served me a hard shell taco with piles of lettuce and some greasy steak. I was so confused because the menu didn't indicate anything about it being hard shell so I was assuming it would be on corn tortilla with cilantro and onion. The tamale was good and I liked the chips and salsa that came right away. The service was really great, as was the coffee (they put cinnamon or something in it). I might go back but I would definitely get something else.

12.description: I LOVE Dr. Berne. Every since I met him I've been very happy. He's great with his patients and has easy bedside manner. He just an outstanding physician. He knows his stuff and has high patient retention. He's educated from Rush and trained in (Stroger) Cook County Hospital. I'm a little fastidious about where my doctors are educated from; it's my medical background that accounts for this. The negative: he rarely has open appointments & it may take a full month or more to see him. That's so irritating. Uggh!!!

7.description: I met with Dr. Berne about some concerns I had.  I was very impressed with his  approach and recommendations.  For my main concern, he in fact suggested I see someone else that could better address the problem and for another issue I have a follow-up appointment scheduled in the fall.  He seemed less interested in jumping into a treatment plan and more concerned that I make the best decision and know all the facts.As for people's Yelp complaints about the payment system, it seems reasonable to me.  If their clients were reliably paying their bills, they would not need to request payment prior to a procedure.

3.description: Excellent experience all around with Dr. Adams and the staff of A&G Dermatology! I received a convenient appointment one week from the time I called which contrasts sharply with the 3-month wait for an initial consult at the other practice I had phoned first. The clinic front desk staff was welcoming and professional. I met with Dr. Adams and found her bedside manner to be very warm, attentive and reassuring. She thoroughly assessed and addressed all of my concerns, performed two small procedures and asked several times if my pain was being managed appropriately.  I didn't catch the names of the two nurses who came into the room to assist but they also demonstrated the same attentive and caring spirit. Street parking is free and convenient. Clinic was modern and spotless. I will highly recommend this practice to friends and family.

1.description: Similar to the other reviewers...these people seem to think that no one has jobs or other obligations during the day. If I was to come to this practice, I would have to take a day of work to do so or take a 1/2 day because they do not care about accommodating patients..by having a more convenient schedule for those not able to take a day off of workmaybe they are doing so well that they don't see the need to but its still a deal breaker.

2.description: Unfortunately cannot give this office a great review. The hours of this practice is very inconvenient to most who work or go to school. No evening hours or Saturday.  Even closed on Friday. Wish I had this work schedule!

9.description: The main doctor, Dr. Berne, is a pleasant man, if you can get in to see him.  This is a problem because the person who answers the telephone is empowered to decide whether you need to be seen sooner that months away.  Unless the receptionist has a medical or nursing degree, this is a problem.  Had to find another skin doctor.

10.description: I was very happy with all my visits to see Dr. Marble.  I had a growth in a very personal and embarassing spot.  She made me feel very comfortable and did a great job removing it.  It turned out to be a skin cancer...The doctor personally called me and put my mind at ease.  Before I found A&G I went to just about every dermatologist in the city and suburbs.   It was either a 2 month wait for an appointment, a 2+ hour wait in the office, a gross doctor with skin growths all over his face, outdated practice from the 50's (a typewriter? really?), or the doctor was just a jerk.  Why is a good dermatologist so hard to find?Anyway, I was thrilled when I found this place.  It's immaculately clean, the office is high-tech, everyone is super friendly and professional, and they were all genuinely caring and concerned.  The only reason I'm not giving them a perfect 5 stars is because they charge you a $10 surcharge each month if you don't pay your bill in full!  I've never seen a doctor that does that.

13.description: I guess they don't need patients...When I came in for my first appointment and was asked to fill out the forms, I was requested to provide my SSN. I declined to give it out and said that our insurance company assured us the number on the card is enough (this was never a problem before). I, of course, had my insurance card and my driver's license with me. I also offered the referring doctor's name to check my credibility, but was told that this is not good enough. After much discussion the receptionist said that I either had to give them my SSN or pay for the visit in full prior to seeing the doctor and then deal with my insurance company myself. So I just left, since I definitely did not feel welcome or treated as a patient rather than an ATM.Also, I was asked to fill out all the info on a iPad-like device (the receptionist said they were going "paperless"). but right after I gave it back to her, she printed everything out, and not even double-sided. What was the point?

16.description: I would probably give them about 2 and half stars if i could. I went to the office which was miles away from where I live, because I just really wanted to get it over with and they were one of few offices I called that were willing to give me an appointment before the next Rapture, and they were willing to give me a price estimation. I had Dr. Marble and she was to perform a small surgery under my arm. I was really nervous because I don't often see doctors and she was...sympathetic but obviously rushed. She clearly just wanted to get it over with too. She pretty much just did the cutting and ran out. She didn't ask me if I was okay or needed anything or had any more questions. I still had other health issues to talk to her about. I thought I would like her because of her Bio but she made me feel kind of awkward. Her assistant was nice. Later I noticed it wasn't really the best job and it looks like I'll have a gross scar. I'm bummed. I was glad that the co pay was so little but I took off points when I was leaving the office and noticed someone had left their used gloves on the counter next to the computer. Guess I won't be going back there.

17.description: Hello, I have been a patient of Dr. Berne for many years and their service has always been great; however, recently there has been a great reduction in the service and accuracy of the billing department.  They have a policy which states if a bill is left unpaid for thirty days after the initial bill being sent, a $10 late fee is applied to the account.  This is not a problem at all because I always pay all my bills on time.  I never even pay interest on any of my credit cards but I have never received any of the letters or "phone calls" they supposedly gave me.  This would be an understandable mistake if it only happened once but this is the third time this has happened to me.  They have the correct address and phone number but I only receive the final notice in which a $10 late fee was applied and they refuse to remove it.  I am truly upset because I really feel Dr. Berne is a great doctor but their billing department is extremely unprofessional and incompetent.  I really hope he replaces their office manager with someone who really knows what they are doing because I would love to be Dr. Berne's patient again.

15.description: I have gone to A&G Derm for facials for many years now, and their current esthetician Kim Ballish is wonderful.  She is incredibly knowledgeable, patient, and thorough with the facials.  She examines your skin, explains what is happening, and asks appropriate questions to arrive at the root of the problem.  Unlike most spas, they don't push selling product.  I have had 6+ facials from her over the years, and have only once been urged to buy a deep conditioner during an extremely dry winter.  I would highly recommend her for everything from a basic facial to signing up with the acne treatment.  My skin looks 10 yrs younger, and I give Kim all the credit.

0.description: I'm startled by the negative reviews here. My personal experiences have been exemplary over the course of 20+ years.While I don't see Dr. Berne frequently (luckily for me I guess) he's always exhibited extreme professionalism. No rushing through the appointment, always willing to educate in detail and offer alternatives. Additionally he'll take the time to explore whether anything beyond the reason for the appointment is going on (as long as you're there anyway) which shows some sensitivity IMHO.The procedures he's performed for me have all been successful with no lingering after effects.As far as getting past the gatekeeper on the phone, I'm shocked that any issues arose. I've offered to take a short notice cancellation appt  if one arises and been called the next day with a couple of offers................... I think it helps to have some flexibility and imagination when dealing with the medical community.,

5.description: i am looking at the hours posted, and i just called, was told there are no appointments to see a specialist for the first time - nothing after 5 pm. ever. the hours are posted until 7 in some cases. i did not see that until i looked up the reviews just now. anyway, called a different dr. in oak park, they welcome my excellent blue cross ppo and will see me in 4 days!

11.description: I was asked to pay $125 (I believe...maybe $150) up front for destruction of one small flat wart on my lip. I supplied this along with my S.S., copy of license, etc. I didn't have insurance at the time, but insurance rarely covers many cosmetological procedures outside of reconstruction.The actual doctor visit was fine & Dr. Berne did exactly what I expected in freezing the wart. It was gone & healed w/in a week.When I came back for a return visit (for him to put the stamp of approval on it), the receptionist asked for another $80. She said it 'might be refundable' after the doctor saw me. I reminded her of what I'd already paid & she informed me this this was common procedure. I told her that in my opinion, the problem was solved & I didn't have to pay somebody to tell me that. I collected my things, and left. This is a bizarre treatment for patients that COULD very well be returning for more visits. I, personally, am a dermatologist's Cash Cow. Instead, I find myself looking for another office just because of this heretofore unknown version of "Let's Milk The Customer". I go to many doctors, some who bill only through insurance; but all of them bill you after the fact. The upfront fee was one thing. Getting hit a second time just for the joy of coming in the door of them maybe assessing you ARE healed is another. I suspect had he found I didn't need a return visit for anything else...I would have paid that fee.

8.description: Hmm, not sure what I was expecting. This was my first visit, but the doctor I wanted to see (after reading bio's on their website) was booked. I set up appt with a doctor that was available, Dr. Marble.I wanted to get a new bothersome spot checked out and also had some skincare questions with regards to acne and starting an anti-aging routine. The way she looked at me I almost felt like I was vain for asking. While I did not feel rushed, per se, the appointment lasted a full 10 minutes, which included the removal of a little cyst on my forearm. Considering the office visit charge and my ridiculous co-pay, this was not acceptable.While I was not comfortable with the doctor, one of the assistants/technicians was excellent and I was impressed by how passionate she is about her job. The result of the appointment was as expected. I walked out with one less spot and some prescription products. The doctor did give me some coupons, which saved a bit of money at the pharmacy. The office itself is clean and spacious. It looks like they offer quite a few cosmetic procedures, judging by the pamphlets and advertisements.

4.description: I recently seen Dr. Berne for the first time and I was extremely impressed with his skill and professionalism. I work in the health care profession and set the bar pretty high for my health care providers. He performed a very thorough exam, provided detailed patient education, all while being pleasant and engaging. His office staff were polite, pleasant and helpful as well. I would recommend Dr. Berne to my family and friends.

14.description: I've seen both doctors at this practice and highly recommend both!  I have always been taken on time for appointments, which is rare these days.  Any issues for which I was visiting this practice were  resolved quickly and effieciently.

6.description: I've known Dr. Berne for over a decade. He's a great doctor and a kind human being. As far as his treatments go, that's where my opinion takes a nose-dive.I went to him for everything from laser hair removal (which was completely ineffective after 10+ treatments) to pimples (also useless).The one thing he's good at is mole removal. He's funny and gentle, and makes the process pretty quick and painless.Office staff are completely moronic and unpleasant with one exception -- there was one assistant/nurse which was brilliant. The rest make you wonder if they check their brain at the door each morning.

3.description: I live close by and finding a bar with the same quality as downtown bars close to the suburbs is a good thing. Also, the prices are actually very reasonable. The food is good and very affordable. They play Latino music but you can play whatever you want on the jukebox anyway. Clean, decent and fresh. That's good by me. Can't wait to get back next time I come home from Cali.

1.description: Went there for the first time this past Friday. Got there about 8:45p, it was empty. I wanted to check this place out for my party coming up. I had first checked out their website and it noted Old School Friday's so I said perfect!  It had a lounge atmosphere, very cozy. I liked it. My friend had made reservations just in case it was packed. So she let them know she had made the reservation and they sat us at a table. They took our drink order and then we ordered wings and chicken tenders. Our waitress was very nice and friendly. I ordered a margarita and she asked me if I wanted the good high priced vodka or the regular one. I was confused to say the least, vodka?  She says yes. Vodka? I asked again. She said yes...again. I asked her you mean tequila?  Oh yes! Tequila. (Uh huh). Anyway, I got my drink, I ordered the good tequila for a higher price, what I got was not worth the price I paid. It was weak and more mix than anything but I finished it, with no problem. I ordered a cosmopolitan next, same thing...weak. Our food order came, my wings were over cooked and tough like if they were left overs. My friends chicken tenders were also over cooked.So now this man comes up to us and tells us that we have to move because the table we were seated at were reserved for a party. We said we made a reservation and they seated us here, yes but this is prime seating for a party, we didn't like that we had to be moved elsewhere but we took our drinks and moved. After a while we hardly saw our friendly waitress because she was attending to the party that took over our seats. So after a bit we left, somewhere around 11:30 or so, there were only a few ppl there even at that time. The DJ had played a tiny bit of old school music but then jumped to salsa for most of the time we were there. Not my thing, I thought Saturday's were Latin nights. Too bad it wasn't as good as I thought it was going to be. Would I go back? No. Drinks are priced too high for being so weak. That's bad business in itself. Food wasn't enjoyable and music wasn't played as advertised. I wish it was different because it's a cute looking place, I have read the other reviews and sorry to say that I would not bring my group of ppl here for a party if we're going to be sipping water all night or ending up with individuals that are feeling a little too powerful.

2.description: I went to this place to speak with the owner (or so I was told) simon back in May to set everything up for out non for profit event. We had spoken about the timing for the event and that every year we host 40-55 people. Two days before the event I get a phone call from his brother Joe confirming incorrect timing and saying he didn't care about what simon said and we would have the place at different time. After much arguing and the fact that we had fliers printed and media arranged he let us have the event on our time.The day of the event ( this is the kicker) joe decides to show up around 11 and tells us that since we didn't bring 100 people we either needed to pay his staff or get out at midnight! We had the place till 2 am and guests were still planned to show up.I speak with joe first nicely to say hey we never had a number of people agreement he didn't care. I then contacted my buddy who is a lawyer and was advised to inform him that I would involve the law and he stated "i don't care come shut us down. Call channel 7 news!"He was do disrespectful and tasteless. This charity event was to raise funds to help kids in need with education supplies. He kicked all our guests out at midnight. To top it all off ... This was a SUNDAY night! They had no regulars just our people. By that time we had 55 people and 13 on their way that had to turn back.Do not support this business!So disappointing!

9.description: I'm updating my review, as I've become a regular of this place.  The more I come here the better the service gets.  I always reserve a table or two and our regular server now is on point.  Music is always great and no more issues with my water downed drinks.  I've come to love this place.  They are ace's in my book.  See ya there tomorrow night! =)

10.description: Went to this place for a party. We had a GREAT time. The location was surprising, we did not know about this place. We went for Salsa night and had an open tab due to the party. I can not say if drinks were expensive but the service was good. I guess comparing it to the other reviews I would think my service was good because they knew they would bank on our party of hard liquor drinkers.

4.description: My cousin had a birthday gathering  here recently so this was my first time ever hearing about Abram Gale. I found this place to be a lounge style venue. There was a mandatory coat check.  The place was filled with seating areas which lends to the loungy feel. The music was diverse as was the crowd. The staff here was very accommodating, responsive and courteous. This is not the place to drink wine, as it's more of a beer and spirits kind of place. Nevertheless, they have a house wine that tastes along the lines of Charles Shaw (two buck chuck) but they also carry BV coastal wines.  At the end of the night, I was satisfied with the experience and I will recommend others who are in the area to try this place.

6.description: The music was ok on Saturday night ( salsa ) . As soon we drove in front of the place we waited for the valet for 10 minutes with no one around , fine . We parked a block away.  Then my wife ordered their specialty drink, it was a failed warm watered down martini,  then music was to loud , I had to scream on my wife's ear . I did like that it was an older crowd and that's it.   We wouldn't go back nor recommend it to any one.

12.description: I remember when Studio 69 used to be here, friends and I would throw parties every month. 25 dollar wrist bands and all you can drink for 3 hours. Plus the DJs they had there were great and the drinks were affordable. I go in here as AG's has replaced 69. When I walked in it looked pretty classy, very ambient lighting, lots of plasma tvs, and the bulls game was on. Just me and my buddy were in there and the bar was full of a drunk crowd, so we both decide to sit at a tall table. We were greeted with menus on food, we put off the food for the time as we just ordered drinks. Rum and cokes. We get our rum and cokes promptly but after sipping on them for so long we were pretty much sipping on ice. The waitress that had given us our first drinks kept passing us by to talk to some guy there that she would check with often then go back to the bar and socialize. I finally get her attention by standing up, and someone else walked passed me as well and asked how I was doing (assuming it was the owner), I said everything was fine I had just been waiting for a drink, but I would like the check. He gave me the check and I paid the bill, left a 1 dollar tip for our "world class" service. I will give this place another chance, in hopes that they can rebuild their customer service level up. I love to support local bars and food joints, I just don't enjoy when they don't appreciate their customer base.

5.description: Its a wanna be downtown club / lounge. They only play one type of music and thats Spanish every single day all night long , it's kind of supposed to be a European place they have a polish bar / club next door. Rude ppl. The bouncer and owner at A and G are amazingly great at being assholes the place is usually dead, the prices are high, the only thing that's good about the place is they have good food. I like variety who doesn't I would like to hear maybe some alternative maybe a different nights but I really do not like going to a place that just continuously plays Spanish music. But hey what's good for business is good for business because they wouldn't have any if it wasn't for their " change ".

13.description: 1) Location is inconvenient and far from the city. 2) Crowd and sound system are both weak, went on a Thursday night with live music and the place was half full, and we could not enjoy the band that we really liked when they performed @ Havana club around downtown.3) Drinks are not well made, and they don't pour enough alcohol to martinis and shots. No tap beer either.4) Customer service is a joke here. We went with a group of 4, had food and many drinks. I ordered a beer and my wife did the same. Our friends started off with dirty martinis, and after a couple sips, decided they're not made well.   We asked the waitress to take them back. They started drinking beers after that. End of the night we get a $135 bill(it's not like those 2 martinis were the only thing we ordered).  2 martinis($18) were on the bill  asked the waitress about them. She said she tried and her manager would not take them off. Then this guy comes (some hybrid between a bartender, manager and a douche bag), basically tells us that they were both consumed half way and when i say hey, they were not, ask our waitress here, he sends the waitress off. Really DB, job well done annoying well paying customers over 2 drinks. (ended up still tipping the waitress $20, as none of this was her fault, and we were fine with her service overall, which was the best thing of all night)I am not going back here, and their manager's attitude makes we come on yelp and write a review about them, so that you would not go either.

11.description: This is the worst place ever!! will never go there again! Security can  not control the fights! Manager is a jerk! Place is a ripoff! Drinks are way too high! Bottle service sucks! They are quick to charge you a $30.00 gratuity on each regular size bottle (2 btl min by the way) and the waitress does not even serve the drinks!?!!  I have had two parties ruined with this place!! They still made their money off us as they have bad management!! It's just bad business all the way around!! Please Please do not give this place any more business!!

8.description: I am highly disappointed with one of the owners Joey he was very rude and disrespectful. The organization that I am apart of recently held a fundraiser to raise funds for homeless and underprivileged youth. We spoke to the main guy Simon who was very nice but at the time at the party he was on vacation and left Joey in charge . Joey the night of the fundraiser told us we had to leave at 12 when our contract stated that we had the place till 2 am .we had about 60 ppl there and about 13 more on the way. However Joey stated that there was not enough people that we need to leave we informed him about our contract and he stated " call channel 7 news if you want I don't care because I can't pay my staff. He had 2 bartenders there. As a business I am not sure why he would not want to make some money than none because most of the people there came for the fundraiser he may have had only 2 regulars at the bar. Many people took off work the next day to attend this fundraiser and we had to refund many of the guest that came at 12  which defeated the point if raising funds I am highly disappointed with the lack of professionalism from Joey at Abram Gale. I would not recommend going there. After all in the words of Joey he does not care if he gets business or not so he will not be getting my business.

0.description: This is def a good spanish dancing place!! The crowd is mostly older latino who are all about dancing. The DJ played a good amount of salsa and then some bachata, merengue, and a few cha-cha-cha songs! This place has some hard core salsa dancers so be prepared to dance your shoes off!!Drinks were relatively cheap compared to other downtown clubs/bars. A Ciroc coconut vodka with pinneaple juice was just $8. They also have waitresses walking around bringing drinks over to you which is nice if you have a table or are chatting with someone away from the bar. I also noticed they had typical bar food (wings, tenders, fries) however I did not try their food. I am sure I will come back to practice my dancing moves in the future!!

7.description: I enjoyed the environment, place was clean and I love the lounge atmosphere howeveriI give only 2 stars because drinks are overpriced and watered down and all the DJ plays is Spanish music, come on if you are going to have a dancing establishment you need to play all kinds of music!  Service was ok, music was too loud

3.description: The moment I entered I knew I was in the right spot. My artist Chris is the best, he was very tentative & patient. The sho was clean even the bathroom was clean. The owner was humble over all I recommend this tattoo shop to the fullest. Awesome  staff AWSOME work.

1.description: This review is loooonngggg over due- but better late than never. I was super stoked to go here because an old friend of mine is real cool with the shop owners and tattoo artists and has work done here all the time. Long story short- I got a tattoo here and the experience was complete shit as well as the tattoo. Got my tattoo put on by some dude that barely spoke a lick of English- as I speak Spanish as well I tried to converse with him during the process. Dude straight up ignored me- awkward. Maybe he was nervous or something- or just an asshole. idk. I got a little nervous so I talked the piercer at the time, Gray- real cool guy- told him I was feeling a bit apprehensive. He assured me everything would be fine. Left the shop feeling good about everything- when I got home and took the bandage off a few hours later I noticed how terribly outlined and filled in my tattoo was. (Couldn't tell at the shop since it was so fresh and swoullen.) I figured I would give  them the benefit of the doubt and thought I'll wait and see how it looks after healing. Well it healed like shit as well and believe you me I took care of this tattoo. I reached out to my old friend and told him I wasn't happy with my tattoo- sent him and the Owner Gonzo pics and they came up with some bs excuse that the needle blotted or some silly ish like that. ( I could totally understand if that had happened in like 1 area- but it's basically the entire outline.) They told me they'd fix it free or charge so I thought that's cool. I can dig it- they must be stand up guys. But no. Tried to set up an appointment with Gonzo to fix my tattoo- got blown off several times and then when I was finally in touch with him he told me he was too busy with new clientele to help me out. What a f*****g joke. Then I find out that they guy that did my tattoo was fired because he was a junkie and also heard that he wasn't a qualified tattoo artist.... Which would make perfect sense. How lovely. This place may have some good tattoo artists- because I have seen some good work done by artists here- but they're highly unprofessional and a bunch of bs'ers. The only reason I'm giving them 2 stars is because of their piercer, Gray.  He did my nose and a few of my cartilage piercings- he is the man and I would give him- solely him- a 5 star review. Although I no longer believe he works at Dream City. Tear.Certainly not satisfied- certainly not coming back nor would i recommend anyone to go here. Should probably care of your clients, Dream City. Sorry- not sorry.

2.description: I would like to start with a bit of history how I ended going to Dream City in Chicago.  I was actively looking for a tattoo shop for quite some time.  I looked and asked many people about tattoo shops in Houston since that's where I reside, however, I couldn't find any that I felt comfortable with.  I'm not a very creative person, I know what I like, but simply do not have that gift of putting it on paper.  Dream City was highly recommend by friends in Chicago.  Since I go to chicago often for business, I figure I would take that recommendation and act on it.  So I showed up to the tattoo shop, spoke to Ganzo where he introduced me to Little Chris.  Little Chris is another tattoo artist and another very talented artist.  I explained what I wanted and next thing you know I was getting a tattoo, highly satisfied.  At this time, I already spoken to Ganzo about coming back for another tattoo. He put me on his schedule, explained what I wanted and he & another artist came out with yet another masterpiece.  I flew back to Chicago three weeks later and another masterpiece became part of my life.  I'm extremely thankful to the entire staff as they were all very tentative.  Ganzo and his staff were extremely preventive as far as safely performing their jobs.  Having a safety background, I can appreciate that aspect of their business.  When you sit in a chair for 5 to 7 hours, you learn and observed how the shop interacts with one another and also see the satisfied customer leaving with smiles in their face.  Currently, I have another appointment with Ganzo and I cannot wait until then.  I am extremely satisfied with their business, as well as with my tattoos.  I highly recommend them and have already done so to some of my colleagues that inquired about their business once they seen my tattoos.

5.description: Wow more like Nightmare City tattoo! I just got a tattoo from there and had the WORST experience. I have 15 tattoos all by different shops all by different artists. So this time was no different for me, spoke to eric over the phone sounded like a nice guy. Got there and he could honestly could care less. Took him one hour to set up (my little finger tattoo is 2 inches big) and kept answering the phone while setting up his station. I wanted a stensil and he insisted on doing it freehand so I went with it against my better judgement. He kept answering the phone in the middle of doing my tattoo and did not say one word to me the whole time. After I was finished he had me fill out all the paperwork I was supposed to fill out before the tattoo including my drivers license with my age. he refused to let anyone sit or even stand near me while I got the tattoo. And made me leave when my friend went, in to get hers. My tattoo is crooked and one side is longer and misshapen. After my friend was finished I brought it to his attention. He got a huge attitude and was like its not like its perminent its a finger tattoo and told me I was "bugging out" I walked out and will never go there again. And id suggest all that read this do the same.

6.description: My girls and I have followed Grey around. I don't feel a need to write a long drawn out review about his piercing work because simply put, he's fantastic.

7.description: Came in with a couple of my friends. At first we were all skeptical of the place, shortly after we were greeted by the guy behind the desk to whom we explained our ideas. He was very nice and patient with us. We later were introduced to our tattoo artist (mine was Ganzo & my friends had Eric) Ganzo(not sure on his name spelling?) was very attentive to what I wanted. Throughout being tattoed he made sure I was comfortable and asked if the pain was too much for me. It was very easy to get comfortable with the guys. They had music playing which was a nice distraction. The process was much quicker than I presumed but the results were GREAT! Both my friends and I will be back for more tattos here no doubt! I also got to conversate to Gray (the piercer) while I waited for my friend. He convinced me to get my toungue pierced. Like the other guys he was also very nice and infomative. I gave these guys 4 stars only because they dont take debit/credit cards & their ATM was out of order. Our experience overall was great and they have earned 3 new customers ;) Oh yea and their prices are also great!! They def. carry experience. Good job guys!!

8.description: A friend of mine told me to go to dream city and ask for carlos and I'm glad I did. As soon as I walked in carlos came up to me shook my hand and made me feel like a regular there. They are very professional and welcoming not like other places that have that "get your shit and get out" type of attitude. Carlos did my first tattoo and I'm more than satisfied but if don't want to take my word for it just walk into the shop one day and you'll see what I'm talking about

0.description: A friend and I went to get tattooed by Julio, and I highly suggest him. He did great work, in a short time, but dedicated lots of attention to the specifics of what we wanted. His consultation with design was probably double the actual ink time. I really recommend this location.

4.description: My sister and I were looking for a good place to get matching tattoos - and after doing a bit of research on a few shops in my neighborhood we decided on Dream City Tattoos. The atmosphere in the shop is completely beautiful, and not at all like what I have experienced in other tattoo shops. The guys working there were funny, professional, and made us feel very comfortable - which is a MAJOR plus for me.  I am a firm believer in quality over price so I was prepared to spend a pretty penny on our tattoos (they were custom) - but it was not as bad as I anticipated. My artist was Gonzo, and my sisters artist was Chris. They both did an AMAZING job and were very easy going and focused on what they were doing. Gonzo is the owner of the shop and honestly I thought the guy was so humble and down to Earth I would have never guessed. They also accept Credit Cards/ Debit Cards which was perfect because I rarely carry cash on me. We are very pleased with this Tattoo Shop and I will definitely be returning here for all of my future tattoos!

0.description: This is a salon for men and women - husband is a barber and wife is a stylist. My review is for Tom - the barber. The hours are limited and it's by appointment only. I haven't gone here for a few years now, as I live pretty far away and setting up a time to get there was getting difficult. My brother still goes there however. Tom has been in six different locations since my dad first started going to him in the 70's. Bar none, the best barber I've found. Most barbers nowadays trim the edges off and voila, you're done in 10-12 minutes (at least with my scalp I am). Tom takes the time to make sure your hair is combed nicely, looks good and professional. I always felt like I was leaving the place with a nice looking haircut. My rating - 5 combs!

3.description: Needed a bit of help on the Cobra product I bought. I was amazed, the customer service was  great. Spoke to a customer service rep, she was very knowledgeable and was able to answer my questions and provide me with a solution that I was happy with. Thank you and keep up the great work! Would buy and recommend Cobra products to my friends and family.

1.description: They do not stand behind their product.  Cannot get anyone on the phone; when you do wl give you all the wrong info.  Sent in product to bogus address given by someone in Cobra Repair; they knew this wld be 3rd product have had fm them since 8/14,  Do not buy fm product; wl not have a good product; super poor customer service and back up.

2.description: I waited months to get a response about a repair, then finally they responded. Told me to send the item to them for repair, 4 months haven't received my item back or any response from them, they're ignoring my e-mails. I will never buy any products made by this company.

5.description: !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!terrible!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! no one answers the phone except the guy that will transfers you to someone that doesn't answer the phone!!! if you wan't real customer service order from another company!!!

6.description: I bought a Dash Cam off the Cobra website as a gift. I realized immediately after I ordered the product that I switched up the shipping address on my order, including my own address rather than my relative's. It was after-hours on a Friday, and I was shocked when a customer service rep picked up the phone and helped me get it squared away immediately. If I had to wait until Monday, it would not have shipped in time. Thanks Cobra!

7.description: Worst customer service .They don't even know what they sell. Will never buy there product again. U shouldn't also.

8.description: The worst customer service I've ever had.  I called other day and waited and waited.  They have option to speak to representative or leave the phone number to get the call within the 10 minutes average call back time or leave the voice mail which they promise to call back within a 24 hours.  I left my phone number and I waited but, no one call me back.  Today is 2days after I made that call and I decided to call back. I called 10:20am and I still waiting one the line listening automated voice recording over and over. They piss me off and I will see when they are going to pick up the phone. The Current time is 10:50am and I waited for 30 minutes and it is on going.......  I will never buy Cobra product anymore.  They had good detector once upon a time but, their customer service sucks now..

9.description: Contacted them twice for a parts request for one of their products and they completely ignored me. I guess you shouldn't expect any customer service from Cobra Electronics once they have your money.

0.description: I have had Cobra radars for awhile now, my husband had them first and then I got on the bandwagon. Recently, I switched cars and my carplug was constantly live and my radar detector would always be on and I didn't want to have a dead battery. I contacted their customer service and was really happy with the rep I dealt with. They explained the options very clearly and easy for my understand, which is helpful since I am not a car person. LOLFYI, they recommended that I could use the Smart Power function or get an accessory to hardwire the detector to my car, so it would only be on when my car was on.

4.description: 40 minutes of waiting to speak with someone and gave up.  Do they only have 1 customer service rep or something?  Get your shit together Cobra.  That's ridiculous.  HELP YOUR DAMN CUSTOMERS.

3.description: I had called this company and made a reservation for them to open my pool.  I was told they would be in my area on Wednesday and set the appointment for then giving my name, address, pool description, etc.  They had told me they would call to confirm the day before (Tues), which they never did.  I took off a day of work to be at home while they serviced the pool on the Wednesday appointment (as I have never owned a pool before).  At 11am, I called the company to see what time they would be coming by.  I was then told that they would not come as I lived too far away.  Mind you, this was the SAME person that took my address and scheduled the appointment.  Was then told they could "most likely" get me in that Saturday and that they would call me back later in the day to confirm.  Two weeks later still haven't heard back from that conversation.VERY unprofessional and disorganized!  If this is how they handle appointments to new clients, I'd hate to see their pool work.  Glad I did not give them a dime.

1.description: Driving around I found this store. ..Great customer service!We moved our pool table to put a rug under and because our pool table is cheap we completely messed up the table... He came home and he really did a miracle, everything was wrong with the table... legs, top, even our basement  floor was a problem to level the table... After an hour he said.." a pool table is not going to defeat me" 30 minutes later the table was fixService fee is not low but  is not higher than other places since I called 3 different places in Chicago for a quote. He came a day after I visit his store!Others where trying to schedule a week after Of topic...he has the cutest dog ever! Highly satisfied

2.description: Recommended by me neighbor. Love this place! Been coming here for years now with all my pool needs. Everyone is ways friendly and know exactly what I describe that I need.

5.description: Gary is very nice and tries to be helpful, however......as other reviews have said....they are extremely disorganized and quite honestly not very good at mechanical things going wrong such as heaters, pumps, gages, etc.....   you have to call and remind them every single day that you have the problem only to be pacified that they will come out and never do........horrible follow thru...

6.description: Is it just me or am " cursed" by the Pool Gods?  How can everything be working perfectly when you close the pool for the winter and everything wants to leak come spring. To the rescue, Action Pool and the friendly folks that work there. When the wife spots you walking out the door and says "oh honey" while you're out can you pick up a few items for me. Wouldn't you know she yells out a few things, no written list, and hands you an O-ring for something leaking on the pool.  I get to Action Pool and naturally I'm asked "what's it from". Give me a second to call the wife and find out. Of course she doesn't answer the phone. But like said, to the rescue is one of the staff. He comes out of the parts room with an exact match. And while I'm waiting for two minutes they service three customers that leave with big smiles on their faces just like mine. Thanks guys, I really did want to go back home to track down the wife and hear her tell me I never listen to her. I'm pretty sure she probably said where the O-ring came from.

7.description: Awesome experience. If you have a problem with your pool water, take in a sample and they will test and tell you exactly what the problem is and how to fix it. The owner is great!

8.description: We bought our first pool last year and towards the end of summer we started having problems wirth green stuff forming on the botton of the poo, otherwise it was crystal clear. We brought in a water sample and the owner was very helpful and told us exactly what to do and it worked. So we went back to him when it was time to close the pool. Instead of trying to sell us all this fancy stuff we didn't need he told us what he did and saved us a lot of money. Well I was concerned that when we opened the pool it would be green ( it was alwys like that when I was a kid). However today when we opened it, it was crystal clear just had some stuff on the bottom that needed to be vacuumed. When we went over to action the owner again told us what he uses ( we have alow chlorine system that uses a mineral cartridge) and saveed us a lot of money. I highly recomend this store, the customer service and expertise alone is worth it

0.description: I bought my first pool this year and Gary was very informative, not high pressuring and offered a lot of advice.  Now I have to get ready for winter, so I'm going over to pick up my supplies and a winter top!  His dog is adorable.  Just wish he would open earlier than 11 on Fridays.  Recommend him highly.  As I was recommended by someone.

4.description: Gary, as others have said is a nice guy, but is a chronic, no call, no show type of business person.  I had an appt. to open my 20,000 gallon in ground made with Gary 2 weeks prior to the date, and he never showed up or called.  I called the next day to his store and a woman answered.  I heard him talking to a customer in the background and the lady said he'd call me back as soon as he was done with the client.  He hasn't called back, and now it's 48 hours later. So, 3 days after Gary was supposed to come open my pool, he did not have the courtesy to show up or even call.  Do not use or rely on Gary or his store, you will get let down, and he doesn't give a care.  Find a higher rated pool guy on Yelp or Angie's List.

1.description: Went here to eat dinner with family on family night and they did not allow me to eat food from Amatos Italian restaurant despite ordering food for three.  We tried explaining family dinner time and still were not allowed.  I will never come here again.  Terrible customer service.

9.description: A bit unorthodox in that you must order before you sit down (if dining in) but I have to give this place a great review for two reasons. One is the sushi. I've had exceptional sushi and I've had poor sushi. The Godzilla roll I had was on point! Definitely the best I've had in recent memory. Two is the service & ambiance once you're seated. The tasty food comes out quick and the place is visually pleasing once your in. Clean, Chinatown style in Elmwood Park makes this a gem without having to travel to the Far East!

23.description: My husband and I ordered take out from here on a Friday night. We wanted to try Happy Wok because we're trying to find our favorite Chinese place in the area. The strawberry smoothie with tapioca balls was really good and the vegetable egg rolls were the best I've had in a long time. My beef with pea pods had a very flavorful sauce and my husband really liked his triple delight. This is a newly opened place and I think they are still working some kinks out, especially with service, but since the food was great we will be back!

12.description: One of few Chinese restaurants out of Chinatown that you can actually get Chinese broccoli and the thick rice noodles.

21.description: SO SO GOOD!! Clean, great service! Food is great, and we ordere from each menu. Korean, Chinese, Japanese.  Thai coffee so yummy!! we had sushi, maki, just so so good!  Bathrooms clean.  I always mention these "clean" remarks because it is very important especially where food is being served. Presentation of food just lovely, taste of everything so delightful!! owners/staff super nice!

16.description: My husband and I ordered take out from here on a Friday night. We wanted to try Happy Wok because we're trying to find our favorite Chinese place in the area. The strawberry smoothie with tapioca balls was really good and the vegetable egg rolls were the best I've had in a long time. My beef with pea pods had a very flavorful sauce and my husband really liked his triple delight. This is a newly opened place and I think they are still working some kinks out, especially with service, but since the food was great we will be back!

17.description: 5 stars for sushi!! Finally a spot close to home.. Menu caters to all Asian tastes.  Plenty to choose from if your with someone who doesn't like sushi.  Very friendly staff, very clean.. Never a bad plate from the times when I went.

10.description: Over priced. They give you a very small portion of food. Also the owners seemed very rude and impatient. 0 starts if I had the chance

5.description: It's a little odd to see a restaurant that serves Chinese, Japanese, Korean, Thai all under one roof and the place not be a buffet.  It was a little confusing coming in. I entered and didn't know what I should do. Do I get seated? Do I wait until someone notices me? Do I seat myself? Well, let me clear up the confusion. You walk into the restaurant and order/pay for your meal at the counter. After you pay, you will be seated if dining in or you may sit on the bench by the window for your take out order.We ordered the Party B sushi platter which consists of 6 different rolls. The sushi was better than I thought it would be. The spicy tuna roll and sweet potato roll were by far my favorites. Our order was To Go so all 6 rolls were squished into one platter. I felt the presentation could have been better, but I'm pretty certain it would have look more pleasant if we had dined in. We'll be back to try the other dishes or to satisfy our sushi cravings.

11.description: This place is great.  My date an I dined in, had 3 special sushi rolls and an order of pineapple fried rice.  The sushi was exceptional as was the fried rice.  Sexy mexican, you maki and mango were the rolls.

22.description: 5 stars for sushi!! Finally a spot close to home.. Menu caters to all Asian tastes.  Plenty to choose from if your with someone who doesn't like sushi.  Very friendly staff, very clean.. Never a bad plate from the times when I went.

0.description: We did not have to order first before sitting down. I think they are accustomed to take out order's. The dining area is small but very well decorated,  good service, great food. Definitely comfort food, I've had it delivered before and the portions are large in the dining room as well. I don't think you will be disappointed. My 10 year old loves the food and he is very picky eater....lol

20.description: One of few Chinese restaurants out of Chinatown that you can actually get Chinese broccoli and the thick rice noodles.

19.description: Skip it. Food is super bland. The Bourbon chicken was terrible. Mongolian beef was ok. The Pork fried rice had no flavor. Noo Shu Pork was average. We ordered for delivery which came pretty quick but we won't be ordering again. Maybe it's bc their menu is so big. They should think about making it smaller and concentrating on making the food taste good.

2.description: Pretty decent Chinese fast food. I know that they have other Asian dishes but Chinese is considered my comfort food. Was super hungry after long day and coming from the doctors office with orders for bed rest. I needed soup and I got soup. Found this place as I was driving past to get home. They're in a strip mall with other eateries. I got two large soups (Yat Cai Mein and Hot and Sour). Loved H&S but didn't really care for the Yat Cai cause the noodles just got huge. I would probably ask them to hold the noodles next time or just have the H&S cause that was perfect spice and thickness. Hate when it's too thick.I also had the beef with veg and was happy that the sauce wasn't too over bearing. I like little sauce (more on the dryer side) and found this was on target.Service is pretty quick. It was a walk in and take out. I was sitting on my couch in less than 30 so I was a happy as can be.

18.description: SO SO GOOD!! Clean, great service! Food is great, and we ordere from each menu. Korean, Chinese, Japanese.  Thai coffee so yummy!! we had sushi, maki, just so so good!  Bathrooms clean.  I always mention these "clean" remarks because it is very important especially where food is being served. Presentation of food just lovely, taste of everything so delightful!! owners/staff super nice!

13.description: I can see why this place is busy. Great food, good portion sizes, fast and nice customer service. The interior design of the place is welcoming plus. Definitely coming back!

4.description: A few errands in this strip mall brought me in here last night for carry out.  I love the bright, colorful, and inviting look of this restaurant.  I have found that places that try to cover Japanese, Thai, and Chinese food all in one spot usually fail.  The pad thai was a major failure here.  The orange looking sauce all over the dish was unappealing.  The chinese offerings were fine but lacking in flavor:  orange chicken, beef with onion and broccoli, beef fried rice.  They were decent enough to serve to our family of five people, and the dishes were mild enough for our young kids.  We did ask specifically for the orange chicken not to be prepared spicy, and the staff was very nice about  this. Piping hot and fast food.  Reasonable pricing.  Fine for feeding a family if you are in the area.

24.description: This newly opened spot is in my neighborhood, so I wanted to give it a shot... Well, they put a lot into the decor and the massive menu display. I didn't know how to tackle the overwhelming options--Thai, Chinese, and Japanese (sushi). Seemed like they lacked focus--what are they really GOOD at? Service was not the friendliest--I felt a bit alone and had to grab my own chili, water and take-home containers, even though only one other table was occupied. Anyway, the 2 of us ordered Szechwan tofu and a Thai basil noodle dish. Both were fine, a bit too much oil used in the wok and some of the veggies were hard as rock, but my expectations were not high. Portions are gigantic, and I was happy my dishes were not sweet, which seems to be a common issue in these parts. I wanted my Szechwan tofu to be spicy--it was not. I felt bad for the sushi chef--he was yawning of boredom. I'm pretty sure he doesn't get many orders, which makes me nervous to order sushi there--just not enough turn-over. We'll see if that business picks up... I'll try again sometime and give something else a shot. But for now, I travel to Katy's dumpling house in oak park or westmont or make the trek to Chinatown.

6.description: So let me tell you about my experience at Happy Wok....Mom in law was having a sushi craving and we didn't want to drive far so we decided to try Happy Wok. She decided to stay in the car and I went in to order take out. I went inside and the lady at front was standing behind the counter waiting for me to order. They have little paper menus in front which you take and look at. Once I decided, I folded up the menu and put it back in it's bin, where she then proceeded to take it out and tell me "that's not how you fold it." Ok so I brushed that off, even though I work in the customer service industry and my customers don't always put things where they belong or the right way necessarily, i would never point that out, especially as rudely as she did. I ordered a crunchy shrimp roll, which was $13.99 for 8 pieces- that's about how much I pay for special rolls in wicker park, lake view and downtown higher end sushi places.The roll was mediocre at best.I saw a lobster salad on the menu and I couldn't resist. Lobster, mango and avocado, yummmmmmy. You'd think. My BIGGEST regret is not taking a picture of this salad for you to see this.....I couldn't believe my eyes when I got home.... The "salad" was barely 3oz of food. It felt like the equivalent of a Greek yogurt cup of food. For $12 this seemed ridiculous to me. I don't mind paying for good food but this was cold and had probably been in the fridge for days. They sprinkled a ton of tempura flakes on top to try and make it look like it was more... Yeah... no. I Won't be coming back here. I was really hoping it would be my go to place since its in the neighborhood. :(

15.description: This newly opened spot is in my neighborhood, so I wanted to give it a shot... Well, they put a lot into the decor and the massive menu display. I didn't know how to tackle the overwhelming options--Thai, Chinese, and Japanese (sushi). Seemed like they lacked focus--what are they really GOOD at? Service was not the friendliest--I felt a bit alone and had to grab my own chili, water and take-home containers, even though only one other table was occupied. Anyway, the 2 of us ordered Szechwan tofu and a Thai basil noodle dish. Both were fine, a bit too much oil used in the wok and some of the veggies were hard as rock, but my expectations were not high. Portions are gigantic, and I was happy my dishes were not sweet, which seems to be a common issue in these parts. I wanted my Szechwan tofu to be spicy--it was not. I felt bad for the sushi chef--he was yawning of boredom. I'm pretty sure he doesn't get many orders, which makes me nervous to order sushi there--just not enough turn-over. We'll see if that business picks up... I'll try again sometime and give something else a shot. But for now, I travel to Katy's dumpling house in oak park or westmont or make the trek to Chinatown.

7.description: Elmwood Park , Illinois  ( Chicago Suburb ) I invited a friend to lunch a few months back and he suggested this restaurant  as it is close to his place of employment. It is one of the places where you pay first and then the food is brought to your table. I had the Orange Chicken with rice and egg roll. The dish was sooo good that I recently called up my friend and asked if he would be interested in having lunch again at the same Asian restaurant. Of course he said yes. So we returned and ordered our favorite dish. Mongolian Beef for my friend and the Orange Chicken & rice with egg roll for me. Once again the food was delicious. The restaurant is unique in that they offer Chinese, Japanese, Korean, and Thai dishes on their menu. How often do you see that ???Next time , and there will be a next time , I will have to branch out and maybe try the Japanese or Thai selections from the menu. Maybe even a Koren dish if they have pul Gogi or yakimondo. All in all I must say the restaurant is clean, the food excellent, and the service prompt. If in the area, do stop in, you will not be disappointed. As a foot note, the food is reasonably priced as well. Also, FREE parking in the lot.

8.description: I tried this place when it first opened and wasn't that impressed.  I missed the old restaurant that was here a lot.  This past week, I decided to give the place another try, so I came back for take-out lunch on Friday.  While the egg foo yong special that I had was certainly good - and it held enough to feed two of us, AND I liked that it came with a choice of egg roll or two piece crab rangoon, their pricing is just too high for the area.  It is over $10 for a lunch special that every other place in the area does for about $6 - and doesn't come with a beverage either.  It would have to be really incredible for me to pass two other places and come here for the same food at that price.  The sushi is also very high priced.  I'd love to try it, but 3 rolls would be about $40 and that is nuts.  Even the lunch combos of sushi are crazy expensive.  Who is coming here regularly?

3.description: This restaurant offers Japanese, Thai, and Chinese so we ordered Japanese (sushi) and Thai. It was beyond disappointing the sushi was not even edible. The chicken satay was chicken on a stick but that was the only similarity to chicken Satay. Perhaps Chinese is their specialty which keeps them in business. I might as well have thrown $50 away because that's what we did with the food. The sushi smelled and tasted old. Not one for giving bad reviews but wouldn't want anyone to waste money like we did.

14.description: Today will be my second time ordering from here, and i love it the food is amazing and so clean this place will definitely be my spot for asian food. its pricey kinda but its soo worth it i refereed a couple of friends and they enjoy it too.

56.description: this place is ok, a little pricey for the amount you get.  The pizza is good, but not the best.  I've also had beef sandwich from there, not that great and you don't really get much.  You have to pay extra to get peppers on it, it's not included in the price.

29.description: Me and family have been eating here for well over 20 years! I know a good pizza and I know a great pizza! Amato's has kept it consistent! Anytime you can refrigerate pizza for a couple days and reheat it and it still holds the same taste. You have FRESH ingredients! I love PIZZA! And have tried many...Amato's my #1 pick! Pizza stay on point and the owners are friendly and your order is never wrong! I get a foodgasm everytime I bite into a slice LOL! Keep up the great work and keep cranking out DELICIOUS FOOD AMATO's!!!

42.description: Great selection on their menu; reasonably priced.  Wide variety of appetizers, sides, and pizzas.  Service- delivery and otherwise- has always been great.They offer calzones, which some other local pizza places don't.We're adding it to the list of our other delivery favorites.

23.description: I love all of their food. My favorite restaurant.

47.description: It's not our favorite tasting pizza, but we like Amato's every once in a while as their delivery has always been fast and the pizza hot.  Me and the wife have also stopped in a few times on the weekdays and it's always been quiet, which is nice.  I would recommend Amato's to friends.

8.description: I ordered one cheese and one sausage pizza not too long ago from this place and the pizza was perfect. I don't care for sweet pizza sauce on my pizza and this sauce was perfect it was just like I like my sauce not too tangy or salty. Amatos uses the right amount of sauce as well not so much that it's dripping everywhere but just enough to enjoy all the flavors of the pizza. The cheese was the perfect gooeyness as well so I would definitely keep coming back to this place when I'm visiting the north side of Chicago.

31.description: This place has been around for nearly 50 years and while it moved many years ago from it's original location on North Ave just west of Austin, the pizza has remained good and consistent ever since. This was where I got my first "job" - delivering pizza flyers around the area when I was about 12 years old. Got a whole $1/hr plus free pizza with my "co-workers" on Saturday pay-days!While I don't live close enough to frequently order from them anymore, I still pick up from them every so often when at my mom's place in Oak Park. Slightly cheesier and a little pricier than Jim & Pete's - which has been the other mainstay pizza place in the area for our family for many years. For me, it's a flip of the coin as to which is better. Either way, it's hard to go wrong. Mainly carryout nowadays, non-pizza items were always good too, though it's been awhile since I've had the pleasure of trying them.

34.description: The pizza here is always consistent!  The Rewards program is great because the more you order, the more rewards you get, it's a no brainer!  Once you try this pizza it will become your favorite!  Also, I just tried the Buffalo Wings for the 1st time a couple of weeks ago.  OMG!  The Buffalo wings are LARGE and taste awesome!  They're not small and wimpy like the place across the street (WingSt*p).

16.description: Best place for pizza, I am a faithful customer Perfect crust all the time, amazing taste. I have tried the multi gusti both thin and pan, delicious! The Chicago style omg! I'm yet to be disappointed. Worth the $$

13.description: My family loves the pizza, salads and baked clams. They relocated to a smaller joint. It is pizza with best ingredients and flavor. Recommend to everyone! !

11.description: I absolutely love this place. My gf and I order from there at least twice a week and we got lots of friends, coworkers, and businesses to order from there. Not only is their pizza awesome but their pastas are freaking amazing. We order so much that we get a free pizza every couple of months using the points we earn. I knocked off 1 star due to the chicks working the counter/phone. A couple years ago they had the best staff but now these new chicks make us nervous. Don't want to get into specifics but mainly orders aren't taken right and professionalism isn't up to what it used to be. Yes it's a pizza & pasta place and working does suck but at least make an effort to care about your job.

39.description: This place is amazing. Amatos is my favorite pizza EVER. The crust is always perfect, the topping choices are amazing, the sauce is flavorful and garlicky...(not sweet) and their cheese is real mozzarella cheese. None of that fake weird cheese that so many pizza places use these days. We recently moved out of town, but whenever my husband and I are in the area, we choose to go to Amato's for their pizza and the fried mushrooms. If you are in the area and you don't have time to eat there, you can order a few tubs of their sauce and a few balls of their dough and try to make it at home yourself. I like to keep a few containers of their sauce in my freezer at all times so that it can quickly be defrosted and used as a dipping sauce for all kinds of things from mozzarella sticks to breaded zucchini. We love Amato's and I wish that there was a location closer to my house in Cary, IL!

37.description: Great thin crust!  I really enjoyed the sauce, cheese, and crust and will definitely order from here again.  They have coupons posted on their website (that you can even just show them on your smartphone if you don't have a printer) so make sure you check those out.  I tried Amato's after finding their menu in my building lobby and am pleased because I might not have stumbled upon it had I not seen the menu.  My only complaint was that delivery took substantially longer than they told me, but I'll let that one slide if it turns out to be a one time problem.

0.description: Amatos has really stepped up their game recently, and is now becoming one of my favorites! They have so many options on their menu, and it's difficult to choose something because everything is delicious!

38.description: I have been coming here for years. I been living in my neighborhood since i was 5 years old. I always passed by this palce but never stop by. I go here all the time, and i take every friend here once. everyone has gone there after i taken them. price is a little higher than it was when i started but every place is like that. I love, love ,love this place. took me 7 months to get there highest rewards prize which is a free extra large pizza. Pizza,pasta, wings,fries and chicken is on point!

51.description: Amato's makes a solid pizza with little frills.   Normal appetizers that you'd expect anywhere.   Good pasta and quality pizza.   I prefer the Glendale heights location, but will go here when I am at my parent's house and with little options available.   They are a bit high on the price side but less than what I used to pay at Armand's

27.description: Ordered the sausage calzone and it was great. Sometimes calzones tend to be too much dough and not enough cheese or meat. This one had a great balance and it was just big enough to fill me up without feeling too full. They have nice outdoor sitting as well. I had my dog with me as well and they had no issue with me having him in the outdoor sitting section. Look forward to trying more of their items.

32.description: yum! pizza is good, calzones are excellent, and the Amatos salad is fresh, crunchy & delicious.all the staff are pleasant & professional & that always helps

54.description: This review would be a 5 star if Amato's wasn't so pricey.  Their thin crust is perfect, crispier on the outside edge pieces, and a bit more substantial for the middle pieces.  If you like sausage as a topping, I haven't found better sausage topping in this part of town.  Spicy, chunky, and perfectly done!  Their delivery is timely, the kids working there are friendly, and an extra large (although somewhat pricey) gives my family of four enough for two meals.  So I guess the extra $ is worth it.  Try Amato's if you're inteh area, you won't be disappointed.

48.description: Always drove by this place but never bothered going in.  Inside was nicely air-conditioned.  Got a sausage slice to go for about $3.  Slice was about 9 inches long.Not there was anything wrong with my slice but, it seemed really heavy and rich with each and every bite, as if I might be getting a stomach ache if I continued eating it.  I found it to be very similar to Coluta's, which is just a few blocks north of Harlem/Belmont.  Toppings were huge and dough was pretty thick.

44.description: I was hoping to like this pizza a lot more than i did.  The previous reviews might have gotten my hopes too high.  I ordered a thin cheese and sausage was really not too impressed.  Nothing wrong with the pizza but nothing to get excited over either.  Good not great.

24.description: Good local pizzeria, service is nice. I ordered a medium sized sausage and mushroom pizza for pickup, done right on time. This business has been here a really long time and their food quality has always been very consistent.

7.description: Great Italian restaurant serving superb pizza,Bbq chicken,salads and just about anything but consistently good,affordable and always spot on.I highly recommend this restaurant give them a try.

49.description: Stopped in here after getting food for the pooch across the street. They have a good special, 2 slices and a canned or fountain drink of your choice for just under $6. Good bang for the buck. The slices almost seemed to be more of a NY style. The slice was lukewarm, but the crust and toppings were pretty good. I'd be willing to bet it's a solid pizza when fresh. Wouldn't go out of the way for it, but if I'm in the area and have the taste for some "za" it's not a bad spot.

40.description: Met a friend here.....decided to have pizza.  Wholy Pizza crustolly it was soaking in awesomenss.Sauce was good...friendly and free refills.  Plays was nice clean on the inside.  Outdoor seating made it all the more relaxing.  Waitress came outside to check on us a couple of times so it was nice.  And the blond (whom I forget her name but is a journalism major) was funny.A bit of a haul for me but totally awesomesauce. :)  I think they have a private lot but I parked in the street.

53.description: My family has been ordering pizza from here for  years. Since they were at their North Ave location. The pizza has flavor and it's crust is so crispy. The sausage is delicious and i'm not a fan of  sausage. Their pizza is on the pricey side but the sizes are huge. Their other stuff on the menu is also good including the fried panzoretti.

30.description: Ordered a thin pizza from these guys.  It was okay the crust wasn't thin enough for my liking.

46.description: We used to order their pizza quite often.  The thin crust is very good and also pricey.  But I only gave it 1 star because they refuse to honor their online pricing and specials.  I will not do business with a company that refuses to honor their own advertised pricing....and on top of that, the guy on the phone who refused the pricing was rude.  Sorry Amato's, there are just too many good pizza joints in Elmwood Park....you just lost a regular customer.

1.description: 7th new spot 2016!!!!I followed a fellow Yelper's review and book marked the place. For weeks I'd been anxiously been eyeing this place, unfortunately, I was not as enthused as other Yelpers. Anywho, I placed a call in order for a pickup med sausage/xtra sauce well done thin crust. Order took 2omins. We passed the place literally 5xs before we parked. Lmaobvs (GOING NORTH IT'S ON THE RIGHT). Crust was good. EVERYTHING ELSE WAS BAD!!!! The sauce! The Sausage! The Cheese.
