WAS NOT GOOD 2 ME!!!! The sauce was too sweet, it tasted like it was poured out of a can. Sausage was soft and mushy. The cheese was just OK. Cheese was rather thick too. I didn't like it.

55.description: When my husband and I moved into our new home, this was the first place we ordered from.  Now, we are regular patrons, loving the wonderful pizza sauce, double dough and nightly "specials".  Both of us grew up in opposite areas of the city and still can agree that this place is some of the best pizza available - and that's a tough bill to fill when you are living next to Elmwood Park that has a pizza place on every corner!

9.description: This is our go to pizza delivery. Recently tried the deep dish, wasn't a huge fan of the sauce. Also, the thin we ordered was like wet and rubbery as if it was sitting there a long time waiting on the deep to finish. 5 stars for thin, 2 for deep.

26.description: Some things are a little pricey but the food is great! Salads are huge, fresh and just delicious! The creamy garlic dressing is some of the best I have ever had in my life. It IS addictive.The pizza sauce tastes great and the calzones are amazing. The dough is just right!Great staff, always kind and they pay attention to you, even reading your order back to ensure it's not wrong.One time they left something off the salads we got, they replaced them and told us to keep the original salds, not to worry about it. We weren't treated like scamming thieves or anything. We were treated like appreciated customers!I LOVE AMATO'S! Oh and the bosco sticks...WHOA YUM!Our work orders from here and needs to order from them more often! MAMA LUNA'S SUCKS!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

25.description: Great pizza!  I eat here all the time, they are very consistent with their pizza and deliver it to you promptly.

12.description: I was a very frequent customer at this pizza place never had an issue with the food or the service..but with my last visit I was very disappointed. The pizza was cold the cheese was hard and chewy. Customer service is probably the only good thing remaining here. Wrote an email to the manager regarding the poor experience my wife and I had with the pizza but it's been about 7 months and still no response. This establishment lost a very good customer.

21.description: I HIGHLY recommend the Rib Tip bucket !! Very tasty, and makes a great family meal!!!

17.description: Best pizza in Chicago 5 stars for taste. The cheese was very stretchy and tasty. There are many item selections. A bit pricey for what you get, but worth it in taste. Will be back.

10.description: I order from here time to time and I must say they have great food and are always consistent and on time! Broiled chicken dinner is great!

5.description: DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY!!!!!We drove from downtown Chicago to eat here on 2/20/16 because I lived near here off Belmont and Newland when I was younger. When I walked in I stated that I had not been here in years and the reception from the girl behind the counter was not welcoming.I asked her what has changed and asked if she could recommend something.She said everything was good and when I persisted about what new things they had she seemed snotty. Then I asked if the cannolis were homemade considering that there is a Italian bakery right next door and she said she did not know.I ordered a cheef and my wife and her friend both got sausage and mushroom calzones and her friends husband a meatball with fried shrooms.The food came out at different times and when my wife cut into her calzone a watery greasy mess came out.The side of spaghetti I got with the cheef was canned tasting and also watery.My cheef was not only smaller than what Im used to but was obvious they used cheap beef.My friends order of shrooms also came out with the meal instead of before as he had requested. We left very dissatisfied and ripped off and received no thank you from the diva who took our order.NOTE TO OWNER:Hire staff that is knowledgeable about menu and not so worried about how her hair and nails look.Don't cheap out on food

3.description: We ordered extra sauce and unfortunately they didn't put any sauce on the pizza for sauce where is the sauce???

35.description: and i keep on loving you...can't help ordering the thin crust pizza with mushrooms and artichokes.  they will never skimp on toppings and the order is always ready on time.  their rewards program is also a bonus.

19.description: This place has been around for nearly 50 years and while it moved many years ago from it's original location on North Ave just west of Austin, the pizza has remained good and consistent ever since. This was where I got my first "job" - delivering pizza flyers around the area when I was about 12 years old. Got a whole $1/hr plus free pizza with my "co-workers" on Saturday pay-days!While I don't live close enough to frequently order from them anymore, I still pick up from them every so often when at my mom's place in Oak Park. Slightly cheesier and a little pricier than Jim & Pete's - which has been the other mainstay pizza place in the area for our family for many years. For me, it's a flip of the coin as to which is better. Either way, it's hard to go wrong. Mainly carryout nowadays, non-pizza items were always good too, though it's been awhile since I've had the pleasure of trying them.

28.description: They have pretty good pizza, one of the best in the area. When I order whatever pizza they have on the menu, and i want to add one extra topping, they charge extra for every ingredient so that sucks! In the end the bill comes out to around 40 bucks, for a 16 inch pizza.

45.description: I decided to order some Amato's since I never tried it before and I received a menu in the mail. I've passed by Amato's a million times and one of my best friends works there, plus I've heard great reviews from this place. The girl who answered the phone was quick and friendly in taking my order. I wasn't in the mood for going out in public so I placed an order for delivery. Stuffed cheese pizza, a 6-pack of 7-up, and tiramisu. The delivery took a little longer than expected but I gave the guy some slack since I'm not particularly close. I'm about 15 min away. Pizza was really good and so was the dessert. For the nice summer days, Amato's has patio tables outside for patrons. I recommend Amato's if you haven't tried them yet!

33.description: Now I gotta say I usually love their stuffed pizza. It is one of my favorites. Which is usually the reason why I order there. But this time was just bad. I found not only one hair but two nasty curly hairs on my pizza. Yuck! I lost my appetite after the 2nd one. Just wear a hairnet, it's not that hard! Well, I am done ordering there for a while.

43.description: Love the pizza great cheese sauce very fresh highly recomend.

2.description: I am seriously in lust. I found a pizza place open until midnight in the burbs and I liked it! So here's how it happened. I was sitting on the sofa having an internal struggle. (I was trying to tell myself, there was no reason to leave home at midnight to eat anything, and in particular bread.) I tried to convince myself to have a bowl of cereal instead. So, my flesh gave in and it was totally worth it!  Amato's dough is made fresh daily, all ingredients are fresh and the mozzarella is the best I have ever had. EVER! There's one catch. The price is in NO way for the penny pinchers of the world.  A small thin crust pizza with three toppings is $17. I called 20 minutes before closing and was treated as if I was placing an order at 7:30pm. I was not rushed and the guy was actually very casual and told me I could order any menu item. I ordered a small pizza and (as she covers her face) buffalo wings. I ordered the wings because they were .65 cents each. Loved the pizza, but the wings .....not so much. Not even for .65 cents. Serves me right because I should have stopped at the pizza, and had I done so, I am certain I would have eaten the entire small thin crust without thinking twice about it. It was that good! Well,  I wish I had waited until today to eat pizza, but it is what it is. When I go all in, it only makes sense to go hard with food that is worth the set back. That way, when I ponder why my rump shaker can no longer fit in my favorite pair of jeans, remembering the delicious thin crust pizza that made it all possible will help me to smile despite the crisis at hand.

18.description: I had tried the deep dish and thin crust at a friends house before but I was very disappointed when I ordered it for myself. The garlic bread had no flavor and just appeared to have a lot of oil on it. The pizza was sausage and tasted like cardboard. I'm not sure why it was totally different from when I tried before, but I will not be ordering again..

41.description: First of all, we have been going to Amato's since we moved to the neighborhood (Sept '10). This is our go-to pizza place. We love the thin crust and it's right around the corner. I don't remember us ever being disappointed. We opted to pickup tonight. I arrived and waited for about 2 minutes before an employee (I assume the Manager) came out with my pizza. He informed me that the pizza hit the back of the oven and a small portion of the crust was missing. Really...not a big deal. However, he told me that he already had another pizza in the oven and he was going to give me both pizzas. Yes, I had to wait an additional 10 minutes, but it was not a big deal. Had the Manager said nothing and  I got home and the pizza had a little deformity, I probably wouldn't have really worried about it. The point is, Amato's requires absolute perfection out of their product. This individual refused to serve a product that was any less than perfect. In a world where customer service is severely lacking, I needed to take the time to give a big "hats off" to Amato's Pizza. Yes, we'll be back because we love the pizza. However, I'll now go out of my way to make sure I spread the word about this fine establishment. Well done to Amato's and your Staff!

52.description: My fav pizza joint in Chicago! Been ordering here ever sence I was a kid and it just keeps gettin better. I bring all my family and friends there and thy all lov it!

50.description: Their slogan is "Perfect Every Time"....it is true!  I notice people complaining about the price, but I'm not sure there is a better pizza in town that is cheaper than Amato's.  Delivery is fast and pizza always comes hot.I miss walking to the old location on North Ave when I was a kid....and then stopping in the card/comic shop next door.  Basically Amato's and the card/comic shop is where all my allowance money went....but I wouldn't have wanted it any other way.

4.description: Ordered a small 10 inch thin crust pizza and a cup of chicken noodle soup for delivery for the first time. Half pepperoni and half sausage with onion. The pizza took a little over 45 minutes late afternoon (I'm 2 miles away) The soup was very salty. Normally I don't mind it being salty and usually add even more salt, I'm kind of a salt freak, but this was like WOAH holy salty batman! The pizza was good, not the best I've had, but it was above decent. I'm new to the River Grove area, and looked for a pizza place that delivers with the best rating and found this place. The pepperoni was a little spicy, so I think I'll avoid that next time. The sausage was good, large pieces and didn't skimp on it. I'll probably be back sometime.

6.description: This is the only place I get pizza from.  They deliver on time and the pizza is always superb.

22.description: Excellent dishes as well as excellent pizza. Chicken limon and homemade lasagna is fantastic and plentiful. Delivery has always been pretty quick have not been to the location just yet.

15.description: Consistently excellent pizza.  Buffalo wings are just OK, but the Amato's salad is very fresh and very good.  A little pricier than other pizza joints in the area, but you always know what to expect.

57.description: There used to be an Amato's at Sheffield and Clybourn.  The one out on Harlem Avenue is excellent.  Besides great pizza they serve a great panzerotti.  If you don't know, this is basically a calzone, but has a lot more cheese and sauce inside.  They are excellent!  If you find that the Lincoln Park location is still open, it's worth stopping by to try.

20.description: My favorite "Chicago Style" Pizza! As they say at Amato's, "Perfect Every Time!" Fresh ingredients, consistent product, time after time. I also love that Amato's is open much later than most pizza places - until midnight most days!

36.description: I hate to complain but I ordered a pizza from this restaurant tonight and am disappointed.  This is my second time ordering from there and the first time was fantastic.  I couldn't stop talking about it.  I was looking forward to having this for dinner and it tastes different - something has changed.  Can't put my finger on it.  The sauce? The sausage?  I don't know.  I am really sorry I had this bad experience.   Won't be recommending this to anyone anymore.

14.description: My favorite "Chicago Style" Pizza! As they say at Amato's, "Perfect Every Time!" Fresh ingredients, consistent product, time after time. I also love that Amato's is open much later than most pizza places - until midnight most days!

12.description: This is truly my go to place for fast Mexican when i'm in no mood to think about what I want for dinner. Staff is consistently efficient, food has been pretty good the last few times I've been here.and seriously the place isn't cute by any means but  I have never seen anything disgusting or any bugs (trust me, I would not continue to go here).Don't go out of your way but don't avoid this place if you're in the area.

3.description: Okay. Been here many times and the food is good. However, while on our lunch break from work, my friend and I went inside to order a meal to eat there. We only have 45 minutes for lunch. We stood at the counter for 10 minutes watching the woman behind the counter take 3, THREE phone orders!! She smiled at us when we walked in but never said anything like hang on a minute or I'll be right with you. I get they were busy but, I took the time to drive there. Shouldn't I at least be acknowledged? If the phone kept ringing, would she have ever taken our order? We walked out and I will not be going back. The food isn't good enough to be ignored....

1.description: Food is great and starts with the serviceHorchatas are refreshing and fajita pollo are to die for Been coming for 1 year now and no dissapointment at all.All I have to say.

2.description: I go here about once a week, since I live really close. They offer a pretty big menu of great tasting food. I get burritos there often, but have tried the fajitas and enchiladas. Everything tastes authentic and good. They also offer gyros and cheeseburgers and hot dogs/polish but I've never had that there. Decent priced and I always get the XL horchata cup :)

9.description: El Alegre Burrito is a Mexican restaurant(they do serve "American" foods also) that does the basics very well. The building is an old hot dog/hamburger joint, and they've done almost nothing to change the place in almost 20 years. But don't let the looks of the place frighten you; they make very good food. It's simple. It's basic. It's delicious. And the service is quick. Sit and watch Univision and Telemundo programming while you wait for carry-out, or while you dine-in; "Sabado Gigante" with Don Francisco on a Saturday night...Nice.They do have a drive-thru, and a small parking lot. And metered parking is available on the street.

10.description: I moved into the neighborhood and thought I should check it out. I went through the drive-thru so I can't tell you what it looks like on the inside. They serve American-ish food too. I ordered the gyro and cheese fries. It was hot and smelled great. The cheese on the fries seemed to not exactly taste that good, but I just thought it was their version of cheese fries. Not sure if it was the cheese, but just a few hours later, not have eaten anything else, I got sick. Unfortunately, I will not be going here again, and driving by it actually makes me kinda queasy. I really wished it wouldn't have made me sick because it is close to me. Oh well.

4.description: They don't take credit/debit cards for purchases under 10 dollars so I had to change my order to a king sized burrito. The chicken taco I ordered was marinated and delicious. The steak burrito was huge. I have a large appetite and could only finish half of it. The burrito was not quite as good as the taco because the steak was tough and there was too much sour cream which leaked out from the bottom. The red salsa had a nice flavor, but it could have been more spicy.The green salsa was far too watery. I would eat here again but I wouldn't go out of my way to this restaurant.

6.description: i have been going here for a very looong time..but sad to say i will never go here again. I just received word from a very close friend of the family that was a former employee here that this place has roaches!!! that is disgusting and i hope the owner that reads this takes action!  Roaches carry disease, and they go everywhere!and it really urkes me that i ate even the chips there that was out in the open, im horrified to know what else got in the food!

15.description: the flautas plate here is the best flautas i've had. the food is always good. the cooks are kind of weird but whatever. I really like their rice and beans too.

0.description: El Alegre is probably the 1st restaurant I patronized when I moved to the Galewood/ Elmwood Park neighborhood in March 2000. I've been going regularly every since - at least once a month. I've had the majority of the food one the menu. My absolute favorite is the Carne Asada Nachos Supremos (steak nachos supreme). The best I've had around. Usually fresh and crunchy chips, VERY meaty and the guacamole is OUTSTANDING! Fresh cut tomatoes, sour cream, chihuahua cheese all melted together in a delicious gooey goodness. Take my word - it's excellent. I've tried the nachos at most of the chain restaurants and a lot of bars around the city. El Alegre's are my favorite. It's a complete meal. It's very filling and that's with sharing with my wife who normally orders the carne asada torta/ taco dinner. The Melanesa and carne asada Tortas are excellent. The carne asada chimichanga, floutas, burrito, taco dinners all good. My kids like the hot dog special, cheese fries, quesadillas, pizza puffs and the rice and beans. I've tried the gyros special which was good. It's a great place. In 16 years - I've never gotten sick from eating here, never. The drive-thru service is FAST and even more so when you call in your order in advance. I have to admit, some days the food is better than others but consistently, they're good. This is not a fine dining establishment. It's a neighborhood Mexican restaurant with speedy service - even when busy. If you're in the Harlem and Grand area - stop in - you'll be glad you did. Just today I had the steak taco lunch special - excellent! Was my reason for writing this review.

5.description: I use to love this place like 2 to 3 years ago but the last 2 time it was just way over salted. The rice and the service improve to my surprise. It use to be maybe they will bring you some chips now they do. People at Alegre step it back up.

13.description: GRYME ASS PLACE....This is the GRYME-DIZZLE of it all. EAT AT YOUR OWN RISK. Last time I ate here I got mega sick. The food is nasty. Then as I was leaving to drive out of the parking lot I see 2 cocaroaches in the inside window of the drive thru window. The cooks are perverts. The place is very dirty.

11.description: I've been at this place quite a few times. It's quick and easy. I don't know how you like your Mexican food but it seems they put salsa right in burritos.Pros:Fast serviceGood priceDrive thruCons:I wouldn't recommend eating in. The place is grimy - shabby at best, but heh, it's a fast food joint.Never seem to have avocados

8.description: Burrito mania continues as today, I jumped the border...of Elmwood Park into the 773. I've passed this place many times, and may have actually been here when I was in high school. But my recollection of those days are all so foggy, so I decided to refresh my memory. The outside of this place looks kind of shotty, but I'm used to that when it comes to taquerias. In fact, I prefer it. For some reason, it usually means the food is good. They have a simple menu which is numbered. Of course, I ordered the #9, a steak burrito dinner. I was not expecting to get free chips and salsa since it has more of a fast food feel to it, but sure enough, the kind lady came from around the counter & gave me a basket of chips and a cup of red salsa. The chips are exactly the kind I like: thin and crispy, with just the right amount of salt. The salsa, however, was the low point of the meal. A bit watery, & not much spice whatsoever. It didn't taste bad, but was definitely mediocrity in a cup. The burrito was nice and big. The meat inside was steaming hot, and the cheese was melted nicely. They didn't over-do it with the sour cream, which I'm glad about. The rice was pretty flavorful despite there not being any vegetables in it. The beans were pretty good.All in all, a pretty solid burrito. Probably wont make the burrito hall of fame, but hits the spot when you're nearby and craving Mexican food.

14.description: Huge portions and good food. Neon sign on the window says "We open late". That sign cracks my husband up every time we pass it. After we eat there, we always need a long nap afterwards from food coma.

7.description: This place had five stars from me before. My son is going to be one this month and I haven't been back here since the day we came home from the hospital. Oh, and this place is 3 blocks from my house and we eat out A LOT. I got horribly sick the last three times I went here. I used to go here multiple times a week so I kept giving them another chance to redeem themselves because I loved them so much. My whole family used to come here. The last time I went I told them I got sick the two previous times. They said "oh, really". Uhh ok. Got sick again. Couldn't stop throwing up.. And it was my first night home with a newborn. So horrible. I don't know what happened or HOW it could get so terrible, but it did. They lost a HUGE part of their customer base. My family went there multiple times a week. Too bad for them- but for us too.. We loved their food :(

3.description: Manager took another job (it was clear he wasn't happy) and the interim manager seems really nice.  Hope he stays.

1.description: Usually helpful and friendly, some associates try and hardsell you on reserving games which can be annoying, but it's a decent place overall.  I like that you can trade in old games, and buy used games as well. This review is for the Harlem location in Elmwood Park.    There is usually easy lot parking at this location.

2.description: I love coming here and looking at all of the video games. The sales people are very nice, even at times when I don't buy things.

0.description: Love the sales for the non-video game stuffthe sales associates emily was great in helping me with theknowledge of the item selections

4.description: These guys seem to have a revolving door of personnel, so it's hard to rate their service, but in general, most of the kids working in here are helpful and knowledgeable and seem to love games.  They're good about not being pushy, they are happy to hang on to a game for you if you call ahead, and I cracked up watching one of the kids working there get into a philosophical argument with my 8 year old about the merits of Super Mario Galaxy.

1.description: Our venue used Domino's Pastries as a vendor for cakes and sweets tables, and we absolutely loved them! We made an appointment for our cake tasting and to pick out our deign. The cake was tasted amazing and the consultant was very helpful. At one point I want sure how an ivory cake with white details would look, so she ran in back and mocked up the deign on a piece of cardboard so that I could see the colors. We picked two flavors: White cake with rum cream with strawberries and chocolate cake with whipped cream and strawberries.On the day of, The cake was amazing! I cannot describe how much I loved our cake and sweets table. Our cake was the most amazing cake i've ever seen. I picked a cake with so much detail work, and it looked great! The sweets table and full and had plenty of choices. Everything on the sweets table was delicious. I'm so excited to eat our anniversary cake. I want to go back and get more.

9.description: I am late with this review. My wedding was 10/11/14. Our reception was at Diplomat West and they suggested Domino's. It was a great choice. We were given a lot of options at the tasting. We choose a light chocolate cake with a chocolate mouse filling. I thought the combo would be too much, too rich. But, it was perfect. They delivered the cake right on time, and it was even prettier than expected. I took out the top of it from our freezer to eat tomorrow. However, it is a little worse for wear. I may be calling them to see if they can make a small replica for us. Also, they have excellent pastries. We picked up a few while at the tasting

23.description: Sadly, I recently had an almost identical experience to that of Robert R.  My fiancee and I went in for our scheduled tasting on 7/3/10, and while one couple was seated with a friendly-looking woman who was going through all the cakes and options, we sat at another table and were approached by a man who didn't tell us his name. (Turns out it was Joe; I had to ask his name about ten minutes into the meeting, because he never told it to us!)  He was extremely rude and made us very uncomfortable.  He dropped the cake books in front of us, then walked away.  About 5 minutes later, he came back with cake samples, pointed out what each one was, and walked away again.  A couple times, he would come by and stand about three feet away  and just stare at us while we looked through books or tasted the cakes.  At one point, he pulled a chair out, and we thought he was actually going to sit down with us and have a conversation; nope, instead he propped a foot up on the chair and stared at us some more. The cake samples were fine; there was your normal variety of cake types and frostings.  We both thought the cake was a bit dry; however, the absolutely insulting customer service pretty much overshadowed any opinions we had on their cakes.When we finally got to ask this man some questions, he seemed to be annoyed or even offended by them. (For example, I asked him how long the cake would take to be made; he repeated the question back to me, like I was an idiot for asking the question, then sarcastically replied, "A couple of hours."  I'm no baker, but I'm pretty sure wedding cakes take longer than a couple hours to make!)It became very awkward for us to try and figure out how to leave the appointment, so once another couple walked in, we got him to write up a quote and hurried ourselves out the door.  Later on, I found out that the shop is owned by two brothers, Vito and Joe.  Vito is apparently very friendly and provides excellent service; Joe, on the other hand, seems to be quite the opposite.  We will not be returning to Domino's Pastries; if you are planning on going, then I would recommend requesting that you NOT meet with Joe, or you will not have a pleasant experience!

5.description: I'd like to thank Dominos for the beautiful wedding cake they made. It was exactly how I pictured it would be, if not more beautiful! They also make bride and groom cake pops but I don't have pictures unfortunately. Everyone loved the cake and the cake pops. I highly recommend making them your bakery!

25.description: This bakery is really as good as it gets! I ordered my wedding cake from these people, and it was literally THEE best cake I've ever had! They have the best cannoli filling I've ever tasted in my life, and the pricing is modest. I loved the work they did for my wedding so much that I just ordered my husband's birthday cake from here. Again, moderately priced for what you're getting! Great place, worth the drive, and the customer service is phenomenal!

12.description: Great family owned business.  Wonderful pastries and specialties. We have ordered numerous cakes and they are the best! Just remember to bring cash.

21.description: I'm 37 years old, and have been getting my cannoli's from Domino's since I was a child. I will not go anywhere else, as I end up always comparing them to Domino's. Every year, I order my Birthday cake from Domino's, as well - with (I'm sure you can guess) Cannoli filling. It's small, looks completely outdated, and only takes cash - but THAT is what I love about this place! It's an authentic, Italian bakery. I even saw the little old man baker come out from the back, one afternoon. A little old Italian man.... still making pastries. Love it!!Did I mention the Cannoli's?**edited** As I read through the other reviews, I see so many Anti-Joe comments. I believe Joe was the little old man baker, from the back! He's old, he's Italian, and he bakes..... I guess being Italian & Greek myself, any straight to the point attitude is welcomed!

16.description: Our wedding cake was included with our package at White Pines Golf Club. The Domino's staff was helpful and created exact cake replicas after I provided the images . They created a surprise groom's cake, which was a pyramid symbolizes my husband's fraternity. It turned out beautifully. I love how we were able to customize our cake however we wanted and they provided suggestions. The flavors were unique and out guests really enjoyed them. Thank you!

17.description: I used to come all the way from central and Caldwell just to go to this fabulous bakery.  The eclairs are the best and the chocolate does NOT taste like plastic.  Their miniatures are also great.  I left one star off today because for some odd reason some of the butter cookies tasted a little like the refrigerator.  I still go out of my way just for this bakery.

10.description: This place is THE BEST. When we went to go pick our wedding cake, they gave us several pictures but I, of course, had to be difficult and pull up a design I wanted on my phone. Not only did they understand what I wanted they delivered PERFECTLY. All my florist had to do was place flowers strategically. Thank you so much for a perfect wedding cake for a perfect day. I can't wait till year one and we actually get to eat some :)

11.description: Domino's has been my go-to bakery for years.  I have ordered from them for holidays, birthdays, showers, bachelorette parties and they even made our GORGEOUS wedding cake.  Not only do they make beautiful cakes and pastries, they are so delicious! We always get compliments from our friends and family on the desserts.  I recently ordered a first birthday cake for my son and they went above and beyond my expectations.  I wanted a "Kentucky Derby" themed cake and they made an ADORABLE 4 tiered cake for him.  I will post pics as soon as I get them back from our photographer.  In my opinion Domino's is high quality at a reasonable price and I would not go to any other bakery!

26.description: The review is only regarding their cannolis.  They have the smoothest, most tasteful cannoli I've ever had the pleasure of having.  However, the cannoli pictured on my avatar isn't from this bakery.

22.description: We had a very similar experience to Matt's experience at our tasting. We also met with Joe. He did not introduce himself and he didn't seem like he wanted us there. However, I'm VERY happy that I decided to still stick with this bakery for our wedding cake because it turned out EXACTLY how I wanted it to. It was absolutely beautiful. I honestly did pick a pretty difficult cake design from a magazine picture I had found and asked Joe if they could make it and he assured me that they could. I was nervous though because there were no pictures like this cake in their binders. This cake was a five tiered cake and only certain layers had fondant that was draped over it to make it looked like gathered satin material. It also had tiny little silver flowers on it that draped from one tier to the next. When I walked into the hall and saw the cake, my mouth dropped open. I honestly was shocked how good it looked. It was exactly like the picture. So overall, I would definitely recommend this bakery but I would just warn you that you might not have a wonderful experience at the tasting, but you should still stick with them!

0.description: I yelped this bakery for a birthday cake for my sister. This also happened to fall on NYE so I was concerned about the timeline. I sent them an email in November and someone got back to me within the week. I was unable to come in so I sent a picture I found on Pinterest. I got a quote (my 8 in cake was $100, fondant, Chocolate mousse, buttercream) and chose a pick up date and time. Two days before pickup, I got a call to put a deposit ($50) and confirm my information. Next day, I picked it up a bit late and was very nervous about the design. Opened the box and it was beautiful! It was the exact picture and worth every penny. We didn't cut the cake for another two days with my family and it was delicious! The cake was still moist and the cream was perfect. My sister was ecstatic and almost cried!Tldr: a little unorganized (several times had to confirm details) but outstanding service, beautiful design work, and delicious cake!

20.description: I found Domino's Pastries via Yelp and realized that I drive by it everyday to and from work. Reading the pretty positive reviews, I decided to go and check it out since my fiance and I have been searching for a bakery to make our wedding cake.Once we scheduled the cake tasting appointment, I thought I'd drop by to buy and sample some of their regular pastries. My fiance and I tried an eclair, tiramisu cake, and a cannoli. The lady who took care of us was very nice. Anyway, the pastries were okay--nothing to die for, but we decided to stick with our appointment anyway since wedding cakes are different than regular pastries.When we went, we were taken care of by an elderly lady who is, I presume, one of the ladies in the wedding cake department of the business. (I think this because when I called a couple times for wedding cake inquiries, I was always transferred to her.) She was nice; she gave us a few binders to look at, gave us some samples to taste, and took down some information in the case we decided to go with them. The cake dough was okay; most of them were very light and tasted very standard; my fiance and I liked the chocolate frosting the best, but again, the other frosting flavors were very standard and nothing out of the ordinary. The lady quoted us a price--which was very affordable!--and told us to give her a call and that she'd take care of us. (We were relieved because we read Matt B.'s negative review about the rude customer service he received. Another customer who was there for a cake tasting appointment was being taken care of by a man, and she was treated very rudely!)My fiance and I decided to go with Domino's, so I gave them a call on the Wednesday before Easter. (They're not open on Monday, and though they're there on Tuesday, I was told that they're not open for business that day.) The lady who answered the phone put me on hold so that I could speak with the wedding cake lady, but she came back on and said, "She asked if you could call back next week because it's the week of Easter, and she is very busy." Okay, sure, understandable.When I called exactly a week after, the same thing happened. The lady was busy and would need for me to call back later. I guess the lady on the phone sensed my hesitation when she asked if I could call back again; I told her that I was told the same thing last week and that I would like to place an order since all the details had already been worked out. The baker woman finally got on the phone and sounded so annoyed. I told her that I'd like to go ahead and place the order. She kept asking me what I was saying, what my name was, where I'm having the wedding--basically everything she had already written down on her sheet of paper. She finally found my information, and when I told her that I'd like to go ahead with the order, she told me that I'd have to schedule ANOTHER appointment to confirm the order. I asked her if I could just place the order and come pay the balance in full, but she was resolute in me coming back; I agreed and asked her when I could make an appointment. She said I'd have to come back in JUNE. (I called the Wednesday after Easter--still April!) I asked her if I could just drop in since she already had my order and I pass by the bakery all the time, but she said I'd have to wait until JUNE since she was booked.Needless to say, my fiance and I have found another bakery that is just as affordable and a whole lot nicer! I'm not one who is easily turned off by bad customer service, especially since people can have bad days, but this was just unacceptable. No matter how great the cake could have turned out, the customer service was quite atrocious, and I am not willing to drop hundreds of dollars if this is the kind of service we can expect even BEFORE the actual day of the wedding... I'd be afraid of what could happen on the actual week or day of the wedding!No thanks!

19.description: I'm 37 years old, and have been getting my cannoli's from Domino's since I was a child. I will not go anywhere else, as I end up always comparing them to Domino's. Every year, I order my Birthday cake from Domino's, as well - with (I'm sure you can guess) Cannoli filling. It's small, looks completely outdated, and only takes cash - but THAT is what I love about this place! It's an authentic, Italian bakery. I even saw the little old man baker come out from the back, one afternoon. A little old Italian man.... still making pastries. Love it!!Did I mention the Cannoli's?**edited** As I read through the other reviews, I see so many Anti-Joe comments. I believe Joe was the little old man baker, from the back! He's old, he's Italian, and he bakes..... I guess being Italian & Greek myself, any straight to the point attitude is welcomed!

2.description: Well, I guess the best compliment for Domino's Pastries would be that the guests devoured the Sweets Table within minutes. We had the Deluxe Deluxe Sweets package (not the official name), but it came down to about 5 or 6 desserts per person--wedding cake, other cakes, fruit tarts, eclairs, etc.. All of it, disappeared so quickly. Thankfully, the in-laws did their best to pack up one of everything to take home for us (bride and groom) to eat later that night.The wedding cake was exactly as I specified--easy on the frosting. It was all symmetrical and even (not lopsided), and delivered intact. I am embarassed to admit this, but the wedding cake was so good, that my husband and I ate the cake-top-layer the day after our wedding. I know, I know, tradition says that we were suppose to freeze it and eat it on our one year anninversary, but....  we decided to eat it that day, and heck, just order another cake for our one year anniversary.Thank you Domino's Pastries for making this easy and stress-free, and delicious!

18.description: Our wedding cake came from Dominos and it was exceptional. We did not go for a tasting as I firmly believe any bakery in business for more then 50 years must be doing something write. We ordered marble cake with Bavarian cream and raspberry filling with buttercream frosting.  We had a number of compliments on our cake how beautiful it was and how great it tasted as many wedding cakes are dry from being made ahead of time.Our cake was included with our reception hall but I would purchase from there again in a heartbeat if it weren't so far from my house.

13.description: My fiancé and I came here for our cake tasting just the other day. Our cake was included through our venue for our wedding through Domino's. We met with Kathy and it was great! I brought in my own picture of the cake I wanted and it was no problem at all! The cake was great! We are going with a yellow cake with vanilla custard/strawberry preserves and chocolate mousse/raspberry preserves. The chocolate cake was really dry for some reason, but the yellow was great! I'll have to update my review after the wedding with some pictures!

4.description: Italian Bakery, yes please!  They have really cute cakes here and all the coffee cakes you will ever need.  This bakery reminds me of a favorite bakery of ours on Taylor street.  I even brought my mom to check it out.  Great prices and friendly staff.  Delicious cheese danishes.  I will come to pick up some coffee cakes for our staff meetings here.

24.description: Our wedding cake came from Dominos and it was exceptional. We did not go for a tasting as I firmly believe any bakery in business for more then 50 years must be doing something write. We ordered marble cake with Bavarian cream and raspberry filling with buttercream frosting.  We had a number of compliments on our cake how beautiful it was and how great it tasted as many wedding cakes are dry from being made ahead of time.Our cake was included with our reception hall but I would purchase from there again in a heartbeat if it weren't so far from my house.

6.description: My husband and I got married last year and got our cake through this bakery as an inclusion of our package at DiNolfo's Banquets. We were not picky, and we had no preferences except that it would be vanilla and have a strawberry gel. Presentation-wise, it was good. We had no expectations going in to our wedding reception, except that we were excited to take our first slice.We grabbed the knife and started to cut off the top...only to find the knife wouldn't budge past the top layer of icing. Our initial thought was "it's okay, it's just frozen." So we kept trudging at it, until my husband managed to chip a tiny chunk off the corner. We thought nothing else of it for the remainder of that night, and the staff at the banquet hall managed to pass out delicious slices to all our guests. My in-laws took the top layer to store in their freezer until it was time to enjoy it for our first anniversary next year.We finally pulled it out in excitement, thinking it was going to be delicious and enjoyable. I started to slice it, only to find the knife was not budging again. I knew it wasn't frozen, because it was thawing out for the past couple days. Then I noticed that there was something underneath the top layer of icing...something that wasn't cutting through.I finally dug into the top and discovered the issue. It turns out the bakery decided to bake the top layer of cake with a sheet of CARDBOARD! And not just cardboard...it had wooden pegs nailed into it and wedged into the entire top layer of cake. Now, forgive me if I am still new to this wedding cake methods, but I'm pretty sure that the bride and groom are supposed to take the top layer home to EAT a year later. (You know, eat as in, safely consume...as in NOT CARDBOARD) Professional bakery or not, this is clearly NOT how you make a cake for someone's wedding.I am severely disappointed, and what's more, beyond annoyed that this happened. Granted, we still managed to enjoy some of the cake underneath. But would I recommend this place to anyone else? Why would I after such a disappointing end to such a wonderful celebration?

15.description: This bakery is a perfect and delicious spot for wedding cakes! Usually you would think wedding cake is dry and gross, but NOT dominos pastries! The employees there for our cake tasting are very accommodating and knowledgeable with the cakes they have for weddings. The cake and the fillings are absolutely delicious!!!! The cake is very moist and the fillings are very flavorful.

7.description: Hands down best cakes and pastries around! It's been 3 yrs since our wedding and people still ask us about the cake!

8.description: Our Wedding cake was beautiful and delicious!!! We did marble cake with chocolate mouse and raspberry preserves! Everything was wonderful and perfect!

3.description: I can't believe I haven't posted a review on this place yet!  We used them for our twins' baptism cake and it was adorable and delicious.  My husband comes in weekly to get Danish and donuts and will often buy a small cake just for fun. I wish they made white cake, but the selections are very good and they are super friendly and fast to respond to e-mails.  I'm not a huge sweet eater (unlike the husband) but I love their cinnamon twist donuts(?) and cherry Danish.

14.description: I got married in October of 2013. We got our cake from Domino's because it was included in our package from Ruffled Feathers. Basically, they messed up my cake. I wanted a simple cake that was ivory, with purple ribbon, and dots all over. You take away one thing from that and the cake becomes boring. They forgot the dots. Luckily, I decided to add flowers to the cake (from my florist), so it wasn't a total wash. Picking the cake was just slightly odd, since their picture books are 20 or 30 years old. A lot of the pictures were blurry. We picked one and showed the guy working, the cake and the number from the book. He wrote it down, with a few extra notes from us, but apparently that's not enough to get the cake right. The cake itself was OK. Nothing I'd write home about. I was just....disappointed.

1.description: Disclaimer: I do not eat fast food.I've gone to this KFC/Long-John-Silver's twice in the recent past. The place is clean and feels new on the inside, even though it's been around for as long as I can remember. The employees are nice too. I've found that it's of keen importance to order clearly because the cashiers seem to assume that always want a value meal. In regards to the food, well. I don't like fast food so it's not fair for me to comment.

2.description: Staff was extremely friendly and courteous. I arrived at opening, so food was not yet prepared. But I don't mind waiting on fresh food.

0.description: I've to a lot of KFC in my area and this one a bit average. I hate to say it but the food is good as the other branches, I find the service very slow. I know a lot of places that serves chicken and thi branch of kFC serves the less delicious one. I'm a food taster to I'll know what's the right taste of chicken from this kind of fast food and I can judge it on 2 stars. I would really love to come back for some improvements, they better be ready when that day come.

3.description: Yummy onion rings. Surprisingly some indoor counter seating. Property is well cared for (which I appreciate being a Galewood resident). Haven't tried the milk shakes, but I'm definitely planning on it!  Cute yard with umbrella tables. I plan on biking over this summer for sure. French fries look promising.

1.description: I like this place - two hot dogs with fries at $5.24 is a decent deal. Lot's of fries and not overly salty like so many places do - if I want salt on my fries, let me do it, it's not a difficult thing to do! Ordered a chocolate shake the last time I went - honestly it was kind of bland.Owner who appears to be the primary employee too is pretty nice. Kind of a unique place with it being in the trailer and all - kept up pretty nicely. I'll be heading back!

2.description: Just left the little gem of a hot dog stand. Great dogs,fries,pizza puffs. Very affordable specials between 2-5pm . Clean establishment both inside and outside. Give them a try

9.description: I've driven past this place hundreds of times but finally decided to stop in for lunch the other day. It's a classic Chicago hot dog joint. I really dug it. I got 2 hot dogs and fries, and was on my way. They use Red Hot Chicago hot dogs and I thought they were awesome. I will definitely be back again soon! The only thing that kept me from giving 5 stars is that they don't have fresh cut fries and instead use frozen ones.

10.description: This is a trailer stand on Armitage about a 1/4 block East of Harlem. I just went in for a dog and fries. There are about 6 stool seats inside and it's cramped, especially if there are people waiting. There were only two guys working there, one guy taking orders and another guy prepping the dogs. I waited about 5 minutes for a dog and fries, which was just OK. Not the best. The fries were like McDonald's, just a little thinner.  I'd go back to try something else. There is a pinball game and an arcade game, neither of which I was interested in playing.

4.description: This is a true Chicago style dog with the neon green relish ran through the garden.  The fries are shoestring and the bun steamed perfectly. Great place for your true Chicago hot dog. Just wish they stay open longer.

6.description: Honestly, there's nothing special about the food, it's your typical hot dog stand food (Red Hot Chicago dogs) with polish, italians, and pizza puffs and all the usual stuff. All good, but nothing trendy or amazing.And yeah, the service is a bit slow sometimes. And I think they only take cash. And it's tiny, and honestly a bit dingy inside.But the owner and the guy usually working there are really friendly, and the prices are right. It's walking/cycling distance from most of Galewood and it's a great place go go on a sunny summer evening when you're out on a bike ride with the kids, or you just want to grab a quick lunch while you're out running errands.It's got personality and it's sort of a neighborhood landmark, I'd much rather go here than somewhere like Portillos which charges twice as much for the same food plus manufactured atmosphere, and I'd definitely rather support these guys than a fast food chain.They also have a weekly trivia question that gets you a discount. I sometimes know the answer but don't even bother because the food is reasonable, but if you're a cheapskate with a smartphone, you can knock a few bucks off your order, ha.

11.description: A great Chicago Style dog.  This hot dog stand is a throwback.  The hot dogs are excellent.  He serves Red Hot Chicago dogs, which have a good taste and a nice snap.  Cucumber, tomato, onion, pickle, peppers, relish and celery salt.  The deep fried polish sausage is a delight.  The fries are well cooked, good, and not greasy.The service is friendly and the owner is almost always the one serving you.  My 4 year old son and I love to come here.  There are several outside tables with umbrellas.  no frou-frou, no frills, just the dog please

5.description: Great place to get traditional Chicago fare.  Kevin the owner is a great guy that loves his customers.  Can't go wrong with the red hot Chicago hot dogs dressed the traditional Chicago way. A must have if your in the area.

7.description: A Chicago one of a kind joint- worth a trip- little place with a very gregarious owner. spotless and quick- nestled right off of Harlem . Not many places left that just deliver what they say they do- a simple sandwich. As i despise  chains- give this little business a chance!!

8.description: Super nostalgic! Love their hot dogs and their fries... The owner and people who work there are awesome too. Red hot chicago beef hot dogs for a good price. They only take cash though, so come prepared... :)

0.description: Hot dog on point. Straight bidness. Id max here any day, if u hungry and got the munchies hop on this spot. Fire. Young metro trusts them

58.description: You have to love the sheer speed and variety at this chain.  I love the lemon pepper but hate the fries - way too mushy and greasy.  Love the .39 cent rolls and beans are good but I wish they had more sides.  A nice touch is splitting a ten piece with two flavours - I like to get a bit of teriyaki as well - and under $8 is fab!

56.description: I LOVE wings, and I rarely find a place that has good ones!Wing Stop has a a great variety. I have ordered multiple times; always take out because they are so busy and the seating area is small.I've never had a problem with the service. The wings are super flavorful and fresh...they don't taste like they were frozen and microwaved. Also, the fries are AMAZING!!Can't beat the price for great wings!

29.description: The best wings ever - even compared to other wingstop locations - for some reason they are just not the same. These are the absolute best and I will continue to go. I never stay to eat here because the place is small but it works out because we don't want to make a show for people when we eat our traditional (bone-in) wings. In the summer/spring/fall time we'll actually buy them, drive to the nearby forest preserve and sit at a picnic table and just eat and enjoy nature. It's one of my favorite things to do.

42.description: I come here A LOT. REally good wings . Always out hot and ready. Good stuff, ALways busy and takes long to order but free refills?! AWESOME.

23.description: Not bad on the wings. Only downside that I gave them 4 stars out of 5 is that the wings were a little burnt. But besides that, they were pretty good. I had a family order of 30 pcs and they gave them to me on how I wanted them. 6 boneless for my small son and the rest with bone.Great thing too, they serve beer, And they have some tv on the corners of there walls which they were showing the football game. So, beer, football game and wings = had a good time.Will come back.PS. Wish there place was a little bigger, since every time they open the door the cold breeze comes in.

47.description: They went out of their way to permanently lose four long-time customers.I was a customer for longer than five years, continually buying the EXACT SAME ORDER every time: 20 hot wings, 20 mild, 10 hickory. It never varied. I never asked for any extras, or any variation from that order.Clearly, I thought the food was good enough to return, until yesterday. I placed the EXACT SAME ORDER as I did in years past. It was noisy, there was a 45 minute wait when 15-20 minutes was promised, so it could be that I and the employee did not hear each other, although I have my doubts. I took the wings home and discovered they looked like meatballs, and there were only two varieties of them, not three kinds.I called to complain that the order was wrong. The employee insisted that I asked for "boneless" wings. What in hell is a boneless wing? Wings have bones, that's how nature made them. After asking for the manager, and if I could get the order I always get, the complaint turned into an insulting ordeal. The manager and the employee were adamant that I asked for "boneless" wings, despite the fact that I NEVER HEARD OF SUCH A THING. He said, "I stand by my employee, he's good at what he does."The manager refused to do anything to resolve a customer's complaint. His advice, "We're not going to exchange them. Just eat the wings." Then, he made an analogy that a well-known steakhouse would not bring out a new steak if the customer wanted it replaced. Hey, dumbass, the steakhouse mentioned actually does replace steaks to uphold their quality of customer service.So, standing by his employee of one year is more important than keeping a five-year customer coming back. They clearly have no intention to retain longtime customers. I spread the word, and now we're up 4 who will easily buy chicken wings (with bones) anywhere else but Wingstop.

8.description: Wingstop is amazingly good for a foodie like myself. I ordered ahead of time, and Jennie was like "I see your previous order do you want the same thing? " I was like well thanks for asking Jennie, I sure do. They are the 1st best, and the one on North and Grand ave is 2nd best.  I always have a nice experience at these two locations.

31.description: This place has delicious wings! However, I had to get used to their taste ( as weird as that sounds) because in the begging I hated them. My girlfriend introduced me to them and at first I would hate to eat them, absolutely hated their taste. Yet, when I tried some more and more I decided that they are not so bad until the moment when I was so obsessed with them that I almost got them daily. My favorite would be boneless garlic parmesan and teriyaki wings, my girlfriend's hot wings with ranch, but we both love their fries.  I usually order wings and pick them up to go.  We have been there once where we sat down and ate but the place is too crowded and too small to actually enjoy the meal that is why we always take it to go. Overall, great wings not too pricey but you do have to like the taste of them because it is different (at least for me).Wingstop is awesome

34.description: Wing stop? Was my FAVORITE wing place! now.. i HATE THEM!!! I GO any where but HERE!! if iwant wings.. which i get soo damn often!!  I love wings!! .... I like to order the chicken strips because their longer and so good compared to the boneless wings! But its been like 5!! times that ive ordered my strips! and they gave me less and they look like boneless wings, i went back to complain and believe me when i say THEY DONT GIVE A RATS ASS! they looked at me like i was crazy,,.. im not! i order it all the damn time! and also!! i ordered online and realized THE SAME EXACT ORDER I ALWAYS ORDER IS CHEAPER ONLINE? WHY SO? cause their ripping you off!!! Never never never againw will i come here.. and BELIEVE ME  i spread the word real quick to all my friends. Damn shame..  and my credit card never seems to work here? till they charged me twice.. woah.

16.description: I feel sorry for the people claiming that these are the best wings they havery ever had.  They are average at best.   The variety of wings is solid but they have barely any meat on them.  The fries are pretty good and the potatoe salad is pretty good as well.  That said, they are extremely slow.  I arrived to pick up my order 15 minutes after I was told it be ready and I still had to wait another 15 minutes after I paid for it.  Sad.  There was no, sorry it took so long or anything like that.  Just reading back the order and be on your way.

13.description: It never occurred to me to write a review for Wingstop until I came to this location.  The one that I frequent in Evanston is clean, with great customer service and yummy food.  This place is the exact opposite.They are extremely slow.  Even if you call in an order, wait the specified amount of time, they still won't have your food ready.  The real crime is that I love the fries, but without the seasoning they are nothing special, and this place repeatedly forgets the seasoning.Lastly, the wings are supposed to be coated in the sauce, but there was so much at the bottom of my container that I could've drank it.Horrible! Horrible! Horrible!

11.description: Getting these WINGS!!!!!!!!!!! Can't wait, I'm starving. With Brian and Tyler Wiggins. I haven't had any good wings in months. Hope they don't let me down. But since a lot if people in here, it has to be good. I'm just glad I got in before the lines got too long!!!!!

39.description: There's a reason that this place is always busy- Wingstop is the go-to late night guilty pleasure for me and everybody else near Galewood. In this neighborhood the food options are very limited in the late evening.As for the wings, they're super good. my favorite flavors are the garlic Parmesan and the original hot. The fries are freaking awesome as well.The only negative thing I'll say is that the blue cheese sauce is super thin and watered down. If it was a true thick blue cheese dressing I could easily give this place 5 stars for what it is.

37.description: I go here and to the Western and Addison location every so often. This one is much smaller, but the food is always great and the service is attentive and friendly. I prefer the teriyaki and bbq wings with some fries. As many people have said the only down fall is that you're usually waiting for some time to get the wings. Most of the time this location is packed which is unfortunate. It would be great if they can renovate this place and make it larger.

0.description: The few visits I've had here, the service has always great! They are constantly cleaning and super friendly. The food is fresh and always delicious!

38.description: Amazing! Staff, food and people are great!

51.description: I love these wings.  My girlfriend and i will treat ourselves with them once a month.  Their fries are good too.  They add some kind of spice to them that i cant quite grasp- in a good way though.My only critique is going to pick up your food.  There is no designated pick-up line.  You are then forced to wait in line behind some idiot who doesnt know what he wants even though he's been in line for ten minutes.  It's happened to me on many occasions.  I just want my wings damn it.  Minus one star for that torture.

27.description: Great food and very good customer service (especially for the regulars). My only complaint is the size of this place. It's tiny, and in the winter it is just way too cold in there. But overall one of my favorite local wing spots.

32.description: This is a traditional Wing Joint. The wing flavors are great, the service is semi-fast, and the food tastes good. Interesting thing is I always get 2-3 more wings than I have ordered.You should give it a try.

54.description: Superbowl Sunday Approved. I gave Wing Stop one mo' 'gain during the Snowpocalypse 2011. The first time I had Wing Stop, the wings were on point...and considering I'm not big on eating chicken off the bone, that was major praise. The second time was mediocre at best. I cannot eat wings that are not crispy. Ugh.So in my laziness yesterday (snow days can be so draining, ha!), I gave the local Wing Stop one more try. This time I told them to fry them crispy, and voila--my lemon pepper wings were perfecto!!!They've made the Superbowl Sunday menu. The less work, the better, right? So the official reco is LEMON PEPPER WINGS, fried CRISPY. If you like sauce, opt for the bleu cheese. Touchdown.

48.description: yes its delicious. the wait is annoying. i order at 4:05 n they said sure thing...15 to 20 min. i get my food at 4:45 no exaggeration.   this has happened on more than one occasion so its my only negative point.   would i go back...yeah but if it remains like the wait time...i'd prob find another wing place if i am in a rush.    tooooo bad.  hope u enjoy the wings.

44.description: availability, its small its quick and you get what you ask for. NOthing special but can do the job when eager to eat some wings. booze, fries, and wings pretty much sums it up

24.description: I love wing stop!!! Lemon Pepper is my favorite by far followed by hot. There rolls are to die for. I have tried about everything on the menu and never can get enough of this place. I prefer the bone in wings over the boneless. I feel that the bone in adds more flavor. Go see for yourself!!!!!

7.description: There is nothing better. Having choices such as garlic Parmesan, lemon pepper, Hawaiian, cajun and more, leaves you wanting nothing more than a second visit!Killer part? You can MIX flavors!!! *angels singing* I tend to always do a six wing combo, half lemon pepper, half Cajun and I do something ever so special with my fries - I get them tossed in the garlic Parmesan sauce! Talk about delicious..... But you'll smell it in your burps for the rest of the day. Just warning you.Feel free to try the baked beans or chicken sandwiches they have. Nothing disappoints here!

49.description: Wings are good like the atmosphere wish they had delivery think they would be real busy on the weekends

40.description: I love wings, and the best wings i've had is at Wing Stop. I've legit been going here since circa 2002. Which is a long fucking time if you've only been alive since 1994. Nearly 60% of my life right there.  I usually get 1/2 mild and 1/2 lemon pepper. The fries are delicious and full of like ~10 secret spices, which are fun to guess. I'm pretty sure it includes salt, pepper, cumin, sugar, garlic seasoning, bbq seasoning...idk for sure. They also have really good potato salad. I usually tend to switch off between those 2 sides. It does often take forever to get the food though.

53.description: I have been here way too many times to count and I have never been disappointed. This is a great place to come if you are hosting a party and need muchies for people. I love the large variety of wings they have and the flavors. The boneless are great for my kids and I love the salty and sweeet flavoring used on the french fries. I can say that this place is busy. There is not another one for miles so people come from all over to get wings here. I always recommend calling ahead rather than picking up or you could potentially be waiting quite awhile. Otherwise, definitely try it because you won't be disappointed.

30.description: REALLY??? People like this place? I volunteered to go get the wings friday night. It was the first time I had tried them. I called the order in and left right away to go get them since I live 15+ min away. The first thing - some guy walks in the door ahead of me when I opened it as if I opened it for him. It is CRAZY busy at 8 pm. I realize they do not have a separate like for pick-ups nor do they yell out and ask if anyone is there for a pick up, so I have to stand in the LONG line when my order is on the counter getting cold. The layout is a mess when it is crowded and it was hard to get out the door holding 2 drinks and a bag of chicken. Nobody moves out of the way and you can't get aorund people in front of the door! I get home thinking these better be really good for all the hassle. For the first time the roomie did not say the wings were not hot enough! My teriyaki and mild were not so great. Hardly any sauce on them and the teriyaki was just not right. Plus, these have to be the skimpiest wings I have ever seen. The fries were mush by the time I got home - the dog got a few and I tossed the rest. I don't think I will make the hassle and go back - unless the rommie is REALLY convincing. It just was not worth the price and hassle to me.

46.description: Wings are kind of overcooked but the atomic sauce is on point.

1.description: My husband and I like the wings here. We've tried several different sauces.  My favorites are the hot and lemon pepper ones. I find that the bbq ones have way too much sauce for my liking. They do have really good seasoned fries!  My kids and I love them here.  Also, there carrots and celery sticks are bigger than the ones you get elsewhere. Service is always good here.

55.description: I really enjoy Wingstop! I always order boneless wings- garlic Parmesan and lemon pepper. I think they pair well with ranch dip. The fries are good, except a bit salty. By the time I get home,they are a bit soggy though. Not too bad, but I guess that's to be expected. I would recommend wing stop, just be prepared to wait.

9.description: This place has gotten a LOT better! The staff member who was consistently rude is no longer there and the current staff seem great. Thank you Wingstop!

26.description: The best boneless wings I've ever had, my favorite are the garlic parmesan and barbecue with ranch. I also like their seasoned fries. The only reason I'm giving them 4 stars is because the place could use some cleaning. I know it's all pretty much guys working there, but common now if you need to, hire a cleaning lady.

25.description: We  have been coming here for years.  The wings are great, especially the lemon pepper.  Yummy!  The staff is super, super friendly.  Check it out!

12.description: This is my favorite location to order from. Lines can be long so if you are not eating there I suggest ordering through their app or call ahead. They have some of the best fries I've ever had and their wings are always cooked to perfection.

59.description: Running late for the fight! People are waiting for wings. What's a girl to do? Ring, ring. Wingstop he says. 50 wings, hot, mild and lemon pepper please. 20 minutes he says. I walk past all the madness now, wings in hand. They are are delivered just as the mad crowd turned to burgers and brats. You're a life saver she says. I love you he says. Eat I says. Everything is gonna be alright, Wingstop, you're awesome.

21.description: This place is much cheaper than bww and the service is better. My favorite are boneless hot wings. I'm not such a fan of the fries I don't like their seasoning they're salty and sweet and it's just too much for fries. The only downside to this place is that it's a bit small so if you're planning on dinning in it might be crowded especially during lunch time! And calling ahead is always a good idea too bc they always seem to have a crowd.

17.description: The people that work their are confused !! They are so slow it takes forever to get your food ! People were yelling " where's my food and why is it taking long!!! The line was outside because they weren't able to keep up with the simple orders that people were getting. And they messed up a lot of the orders !! Good food but the service is thumbs down!!!

10.description: Rip off BWW.. I had the boneless mango... this meal should compete with chinese food it taste more like sesame chicken(cat meat) not wings...BWW on another level..Lemon pepper was the most saltiest chicken..I think I need to get on BP meds after eating them...

5.description: Upon further review; THE NEW, wing champion of the wing-chain  WORRRRRRRLLLLLLLDDDDD!  Have been enjoying their wings for years.  Almost always take out, but today, because they had a new flavor ) spicy Korean and I was free for lunch so decided to go and eat there instead of carrying out  WOW.  Double Wow!  First the wings themselves, PHENOMENAL!  Succulent, absolutely delicious, probably the best wings I've had, anywhere, in quite a while.  And the spicy Korean sauce was delicious.  So were the fries.  Dining in made a world of difference, previously I believed this place had been surpassed by its competitor ... but it aint so, Wingstop still has it going on!!!!

3.description: My boyfriend swears on this Wingstop location. Probably with his life. According to him, this is the only Wingstop that will give you more than you've paid for. And so far, he's been right. This Wingstop has never let me down. And sometimes food does let me down. But it's not your fault, food. Plus this Wingstop makes me a happy happy girl! Order ahead online to avoid a wait. Unfortunately you still have to wait in line to pay in order to pick your order up. There really should be a separate line for online order pickups! I recommend Louisiana Rub & Cajun. Deeeeelish!

35.description: We've been here a few times in the past, and I have always loved their lemon-pepper wings, the garlic-parmesan, and their original hot.  Even tried the super-hot atomic and loved them.  But this last visit was very disappointing.  There was nobody waiting to order when we came in, and we walked right up.  We weren't even acknowledged, and had to wait a few minutes for the guy to get off of the computer and even take a phone call before he even made eye contact with us.  You know, a simple "hi, be right with you" is all I need.  We ordered lemon-pepper, original, and teriyaki wings.  The wings were really tiny, and the lemon-pepper was very salty.  The original hot wings were good and the bleu cheese sauce was wonderful as usual.  May have to find another wing place.

19.description: Not bad on the wings. Only downside that I gave them 4 stars out of 5 is that the wings were a little burnt. But besides that, they were pretty good. I had a family order of 30 pcs and they gave them to me on how I wanted them. 6 boneless for my small son and the rest with bone.Great thing too, they serve beer, And they have some tv on the corners of there walls which they were showing the football game. So, beer, football game and wings = had a good time.Will come back.PS. Wish there place was a little bigger, since every time they open the door the cold breeze comes in.

28.description: Still torn between BWW and this place...Original Hot, where have you been all my life! Great fries, and LOVE the ranch.One time I got some baby wings which completely threw me off, but they totally redeemed themselves the next week. Service usually cool, no complaints in that department.Pros:original hot!fries and its seasoningranch, i think they mix something else in it hahaCons:ummm, add more drink fountainsHappy Eating People!

45.description: Wingstop chicken wings are finger licking good. I always order the original hot and the barbecue, and I eat them like they are going out of style, they are that good! The cheese sauce is a must have for the fries and don't forget the ranch dip for the wings. I wish they could expand the place, it gets pretty crowded on the weekends, but that doesn't take away from the taste of the wings. They are really good!

33.description: Daaaaaamn, some people take their wings seriously.  This location is small and if you're at the table by the door, you're going to have a line of people hovering around you while you eat.  Whatevs.  I eat boneless now, so I don't mind an audience, but if you're a messy wing eater, you might want a table on the other side.  TVs are small, service was kind of slow BUT..they have grape pop!  I always think I'm going to be disappointed with Wingstop wings, but I never am.  Plus, the fries are addicting.

43.description: These wings are great. The fries are actually pretty dam good too. They always give you 2-3 extra wings per order, which I think is awesome. Ive never had any of the variations, I am a traditional hot wing guy, but overall its some good eats.

2.description: First time trying WS. I ordered boneless garlic Parmesan and Korean bbq. Wholly sodium!! Both flavors were too salty for my liking. The wings however were a good size and served hot. I also had fries, which were or looked like hand cut so a star for that. The service was nice, friendly and fast on both ends. Star for that! Will I go back?? Hmmm should I give it another shot?? We'll see

18.description: I've ordered carryout from here more times than I can remember. In the past, it's been amazing - fresh wings, quick service, etc. but the last couple times I went have not been so good. 1. When picking up an order, we made a last minute request for an extra order of fries. We paid and waited. And waited. And waited. Finally, I asked someone if our extra fries were done yet, and he checks a bag and hands it to us. That bag had been sitting there for at least 10 minutes. We thought we were waiting on fresh fries to be made but instead we were treated with lukewarm wings and fries thanks to someone's forgetfulness. 2. We picked up and order and went home only to find that they gave us double the amount of one flavor and zero of another flavor that we ordered. On top of that, they only gave us one order of fries when we ordered (and paid for) two orders.3. This one is more minor, but still an annoyance. We picked up an order and went home to find that they put in all blue cheese sauce, and none of the other sauces that we ordered. Again, not a huge deal, but also it should have been done right.The lesson is that while the food is very good, make sure to completely check your order before you leave.

41.description: HE - "What do you want to eat?  Johnnies, Jimmy Johns, New Star, Wok/Roll, McDonalds, Wing Stop?"ME:  "NO, NO, NO, NO, NO & NO!  I don't want any of those places and I don't even eat McDonalds.  I had Wing Stop some years ago and did not like it."HE, after coming home w/ and consuming dried up looking wangettes and burnt fries - "THAT SUCKED!"~Please help ME to stop being lazy and to cook more meals at home so He never has to make a stop at Wingstop ever again~

52.description: Love love love me some Wingstop! I'll take this over any other wing place I've been to in a heartbeat. This location is much smaller than the one that recently opened in Northlake, so you most likely should order for pick-up or carry-out because this location can get packed quickly.But that doesn't change the quality of the food. The wings here are just as great as the ones from the Northlake location. Everything is made fresh as soon as you order, and with your flavors of choice. Again, I choose the boneless strips over the traditional. That's my personal preference but everyone else I frequent Wingstop with insists that the traditional wings are much better; I can't imagine how much better these can get!I still love their blue cheese, it gets me everytime. As I stated in my other Wingstop review, I'm not even a fan of blue cheese, in fact, I hate it elsewhere. But everytime I order wings from Wingstop I make SURE to get the blue cheese.The service at this location is good as well. My one friend comes so often that they remember him by name, and even agree to combine two sauces together for him, he calls it "Reggie Sauce", which is a combination of two of Wingstop's sauces. I think it's pretty cool for them to remember him and allow him to do that.Overall, again, Wingstop holds my favorite wings all around.

50.description: Wing stop is the best wings hands down! Not a huge fan of the boneless strips because the regular wings get crispy and that's the best part :)  you must try original hot and garlic parmesan.  Funky breath is so worth it LOL

4.description: This place used to be the best and actually was the first wingstop in illinois, unfortunately they are so busy that they pre-fry their wings and when you eat them they are dry and hard like a rock. I really like the owner but i see he is so overwhelmed that he has overlooked the quality of his food. Definitely not like before, truly disappointed and saddened by this because i love wings.

6.description: Hands down my favorite wingstop location. I've been coming here for years so most of the guys who've worked at this location know me on a first name basis. They're amazing. I usually order my food with the wingstop app and pick it up. It's usually quite crowded but this is honestly the best wingstop location in Illinois. My orders are always accurate and my food is usually always fresh!

22.description: I've ordered carryout from here more times than I can remember. In the past, it's been amazing - fresh wings, quick service, etc. but the last couple times I went have not been so good. 1. When picking up an order, we made a last minute request for an extra order of fries. We paid and waited. And waited. And waited. Finally, I asked someone if our extra fries were done yet, and he checks a bag and hands it to us. That bag had been sitting there for at least 10 minutes. We thought we were waiting on fresh fries to be made but instead we were treated with lukewarm wings and fries thanks to someone's forgetfulness. 2. We picked up and order and went home only to find that they gave us double the amount of one flavor and zero of another flavor that we ordered. On top of that, they only gave us one order of fries when we ordered (and paid for) two orders.3. This one is more minor, but still an annoyance. We picked up an order and went home to find that they put in all blue cheese sauce, and none of the other sauces that we ordered. Again, not a huge deal, but also it should have been done right.The lesson is that while the food is very good, make sure to completely check your order before you leave.
